product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: A amazing workbook. My daughter is learning how to write (shes in preschool). This book is a great tool. I love it because I am not a teacher. I need help teaching my child these things in a way that an educator would. This book definetly does that. Its very age appropriate and my daughter likes it more than anything else we have tried.
titles: A great tool for teaching preschoolers

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: My toddler started late in school (2 1/2) and he showed no interest in learning at all. I purchase this book which is for beginners to learn how to trace. Now, he is almost three and does the work on his own without any hesitation. Excellent book

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: Such a great experience book for little ones. I definitely learnt a lot about my child favorite shape 😀. It does help with practice of holding pencil / marker and to focus on the project. I am very satisfied.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: I was looking for a wipe clean book my son could reuse, and when I typed it in the My First Learb to Write Workbook was the first to pop up. It would have been perfect if it were what I was looking for.
titles: Not what I wanted at all

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents:
*SEE PRODUCT DEMONSTRATION VIDEO* for A look inside the book at activities, pages and additional learning not listed on cover in full depth

I purchased this specifically to help aid in supplemental learning during the closure of schools due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

This is amazing for a preschool learning tool and right off the bat different from any preschool learning book I have purchased in the past.

This supplemental learning workbook stood out against the Pack right away because of these key factors

1) it covered Capital and lowercase letters and numbers in one book

2) The number of times it gave for practicing each letter in lowercase and uppercase as well as the numbers was significant compared to other workbooks (A large issue I had with workbooks previously is they would have the child write a letter four or five times… This workbook has your child at minimum writing each letter 15 to 20 times really getting that repetition in there for memory and retention)

3) It covered more than just writing the letters and numbers there were activity Pages that practiced pen strokes and different curves and lines where your child Would be writing and turning the pen different ways without allowing it to leave the paper practicing hand mannerisms they would use while writing letters and numbers on their own.

4) This workbook also covered shapes which I wasn’t expecting because it was not listed on the front but was nice to take breaks from letters and numbers here and there

5) My daughter actually asks me to do Her workbook which tells me that she enjoys it and feels accomplished when completing pages
titles: Must buy for preschool home learning tool!! Different from other workbooks out there in many ways

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: I thought this was one that you could use the dry erase pens on, but it is not. so that was dissapointing to me. my boys had one that was erasable when they were young and it was awesome. but this one once its done its done, no redoing it. so i would not buy this again

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: Good book that covers all the basics of writing letters and numbers. Purchased for my 5 year old. He likes it about as much as a 5 year old likes learning workbooks. As a mom, I think it’s a great starter book!
titles: Great starter workbook for letters and numbers.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: Letter and numbers are big! Very good for kids learning to write. Very clear and easy!

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents:
Great for helping little ones start there journey to writing. Helps to show tracing and pencil movement learning letters numbers and shapes
Highly recommended for early learners

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: When I saw the word "Yak" spelled as "Yack", I new I had to review this workbook. How embarrasing for the publisher, and what a shame to educate kids with this kind of material. Disappointing.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: This workbook isn’t a wipeable book as described. Please change your description so people don’t make a mistake of ordering this thinking they are going to get what you are claiming.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: I’m extremely happy with this book. The activities are age/skill level appropriate, the pages are vibrant with good quality printing. My 4 year old son enjoys working in this book a lot. If I had to pick one thing I didn’t like about it, it would be that they intended for kids to work in the book; I’d much prefer perforated pages because we are taking them out to work on clipboards.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: Great book. I love the first couple of pages and how it introduces hand writing to kids and makes it fun. It starts off with zig zag lines and curved lines, but in a fun and colorful way. Then it moves in to shapes. Then it has the ABCs. I’m using this book to improve my 3 year old handwriting skills and she loves it. She didn’t like writing before it. I’ve seen a major improvement.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: Bought this book for my 4 yr old. He missed a big portion of the school year and needed help with writing his letters. I love that this one is not just letters. There are other practice options! He loved the cars page, best! He is doing a little each day and I am excited to buy more from this author!

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: Super disappointed with this workbook. The picture examples of the product show five pre writing pages with fun and colorful tracing activities, which is why I bought the book. Those are the only pre writing pages- the rest are boring letter practice and letter tracing- not something my 3 year old is ready for yet. So many better options out there that encourage fun while learning.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: It has a lot of different exercise for kids to do. There's shapes, letters and numbers. It's a thick book. My 4 year old had an easy time tracing everything.
titles: Easy for toddlers. A lot of material to trace

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: A bit pricey for the activities on this book but, over it's an OK book. The best parts of this workbook are the pre-handwriting illustrations which are great but very few, everything else is regular alphabet tracking illustrations which you can find in any dollar store activity book. The book is a regular size 8x11 and not very thick either. But overall OK, so not a total waste of money, I just wish there had been more pre-handwriting skills activities which would have made this book worth it.
titles: A bit pricey for the activities on this book, over it's an OK book.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: Great tool to help small children learn to draw shapes and write letters and numbers! My granddaughter is left-handed so I was having trouble helping her practice writing letters and numbers. This book takes the child step-by-step in tracing the dotted lines for basic straight lines, then wavy lines, and shapes; and then progresses to writing letters and numbers. After looking at this book, and trying out the first five pages with her, I have no doubt that she will be writing letters and words on her own by the end of the book. The book also has numbers and counting exercises. There is even a certificate at the end of the book that you can give the child upon completion. I will definitely be ordering a 2nd book for my youngest grandchild!

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: Good for 3 and 4 yr olds. I had bought the next level up book with all letters and words to trace, and my near 4 yr old was having trouble and told me it was a little hard for her on certain letters. This book has squiggle lines, shapes, zip zags, etc that are easier for pre-k just starting out. Highly recommend as a first step to regular writing. My daughter is really enjoying this book and it isn't too challenging for her.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents:
My four year old son wanted to keep practicing his writing and he likes using workbooks. He is half way done already and he's peachy keen.

We homeschool. And yes, we know there are many free options/printables, but our children do like these types of workbooks and being able to do them on their own free time. I would recommend this for practice, but it is not something I consider true curriculum.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: Ordered this for my almost 4 year old granddaughter. We started this morning, we love it!!!

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: I've bought tons of writing books. Some are very short and not worth the amount of money I paid for them. Some are not well explained, confusing, or not challenging enough. This one is perfect! Long book that could last you all summer long. It has numbers and letters, lots of room for your child to practice A-Z over and over again, in lower case and upper case. Highly recommend it.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: With the grandchildren in pre-k home we needed something other than tv. Children need the structure of school. We use this for 15 min in the morning and afternoon (we bought 2 other ones that we also use). This keeps structure and their minds active. It can be wiped clean and reused. It gives us real time together. Worth every penny!!

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: I ordered this for my 3 (almost 4) year old. I homeschool my children, and he wanted a workbook like his older siblings. This definitely fit the bill. The price is great and the activities in the book are perfect for his age/ability level. Thanks to this book, he's learning how to trace letters and numbers! Love it!

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: My only complaint is I wish it were capital letters. Most kids start with capital letters then go to lower case letters. Other than that, this is fantastic.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: I got a lot of learning material for my 3.5 y/o. Because of the qarantine, I have to engage and teach, that the ability to write won’t get lost. This one is the best. It is very well made, the paper is thick, if we use a marker it won’t go trough the page. The pictures are bright and colorful. The letters are big, it’s easy to trace. The price is good.
titles: Great quality, thick paper, colorful pictures

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: Great beginner book for kids to learn their letters, shapes, and numbers. However, for the price, I noticed the Dollar Tree has the same exact book for $1. If you cannot get to the Dollar Tree, I would recommend buying online. However, much cheaper at the store for $1 versus $7 for the SAME book.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: I like this book for my three years old! It helps him practice writing skills a lot. The assignments are well designed for a three years old. I can his improvement as he practices more. You can make some copies of the letter ones before he starts, so you can have extra copies for the letters’ practice.
titles: Good practice for a three years old

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: My son finds it difficulty to pay attention to something for a long time, but this book has proved to be a great way to get him to practice his letters. It's made fun from the beginning, since he does not realize he is actually practicing skills useful for letter writing. Great book!
titles: So much better than other writing books for kids!

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: Got this for my 3 y.o. and I know she'll love it. I got tired of printing pages out. So we can now keep track of progress and go along in order with alphabet and numbers. There is even a certificate at the end of the book, which I know she'll love and will be looking forward to!

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: I am not a teacher. With school canceled with little notice, I hit Amazon for good alternatives for home teaching. I think this is great to get into kids hands early (age 2-3), but will work for kids age 5-6 that may not have the dexterity or coordination developed yet.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: This book’s quality is thick, kids like to color on the shapes also paper won’t melt from the colors. This is a very good workbook for children who are just beginning to learn to write. They can learn to write shapes, letters and Numbers. I will recommend this book to children who are just beginning to learn.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: We got this for my 3.5 year old son during covid quarantine and he loved it. He called it his “work” and would sit next to my husband and I while we were on our laptops learning his letters. The pictures are fun to color, it’s just the right amount of learning and fun. Highly recommend this book!

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: I have a new 4 year old and this book has been great to have during the quarantine to practice our letters. Giving 4 stars because I wish the pages perforated so you could tear them out. It would make it much easier!

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: My toddler isn’t in school she’s one month over the limit so I got this for her and I’m so happy it’s perfect for her skill set and she’s learning really well with it ❤️❤️❤️ Love this book
titles: Best thing I’ve gotten for my child!

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: My little guy loves this workbook! He is learning all of his letter and numbers and shapes before he heads to Pre-K in the fall! I especially love that he can use a dry Warsaw marker and we just wipe it down and he can use over and over!

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: I bought this book for my preschooler. I like the facts that the letters and numbers to trace are really big. There are also pictures for each letter. A nice activity book for young kids.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: Great workbook for preschool aged children to trace letters and practice controlling their shapes and lines! This book has a lot of content and was worth the money!!

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: Good overall basic writing workbook. Would be better if the pages were perforated so that my little guy didn't have to work around the crease on each page, and I could reuse some pages in dry-erase sheets. Could be more interesting for the age group just learning how to use a writing tool.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: Great book for my preschooler to practice writing letters and numbers. It’s a simple book, but has nice size letters and numbers to trace. The only thing I wish it had was easy tear out pages.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: Bought this for my son to learn tracing letter and the book is working well.. He traces well in tablets but with this book hoping that he would learn how to hold pencil properly and trace it. Will update review as he uses it more.
titles: Decent workbook for prek kids to learn

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: This book is nice and my 4 year likes it. My only complaint is the pages are a little thin, so marker bleeds through. We now remember to use crayons and color pencils only.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: perfect for litte writters! bought this for my 3 year old-- his attention span isn't quite long enough to complete full pages but he gets the idea and is excited to use the book !

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: I am preparing for Kindergarten with my 5 year old, we did a lot of research but this book caught our eyes, Great colors, bright, fun to do activities. Would highly recommend.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents:
He getting there I’m learning what the product is for but it does help him and gives him an idea of what he can do then what he supposed to be doing
He still prefers to draw circles

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: I like how clean and crisp it looks!!!!

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: Bought this for my preschooler because, let’s face it, I’m no teacher and this quarantine is not bringing out my teacher side! This book is great. I’ll probably a few more copies!

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: Already on page 5 and only got this a few days ago!! My son is 4 and now without day care for 2 month cuz of covid so we figured we needed to step it up. Great notebook!

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: This is awesome for my 4 year old during this Coronavirus stay at home order. The tracing is helping him form letters better and he loves doing new letters each day.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents:
My daughter absolutely loves this book she feels that she has control over everything lol

I would highly recommend this to anyone who wants to teach there child to write or to anyone who is having an issue with neatness

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: Perfect for isolation! My grandson is 4 and missing all preschool classes due to school closings during covid 19. He loves learning and this book is awesome
titles: Great for teaching a toddler during Coronavirus lockdown

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: My son will be in kindergarten this year. Wanted a head start so he doesn’t feel so lost. You have to ease them into it. Do a page a day and now he loves it.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: My toddler girl's writing has improved so much so far since she started using this book. She is able to write her name now after going through this book. Surely recommend.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: This book helped my 4 year old tremendously with tracing and writing. I highly suggest for those struggling with how to trace or issues with writing.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: Bought this for my 4 yo son to keep up with studies since his preschool closed due to Covid19. He never likes to study with me but this book is so colorful and has so many interesting pages that my son doesn't mind doing the tasks.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: Our active 3-yr-old grandson will sit for a few minutes to practice daily with this book. Size of letters & numbers is perfect, good layout.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: I love this writing book. It starts with basic writing strokes and the moves into letters. Kept my prek baby busy during the stay at home order.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: This book is perfect for little beginners to f writing. My daughter is going to Kindergarten and by the time she completes this book she will be ready!

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: This is great! The full-color workbook help students start with learning how to trace lines, curves, and zig-zags. We are loving this with our five year old!

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: I took a glance inside of it and it’s very good for toddlers learning early but i want my 3 year old to have this book to see how he do

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: Perfect for my 5 year old who needs a little extra help. He's in Pre-K. These pages aren't too hard for him and he enjoys doing them.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: This is a good starter book. The only thing is i wish they had more practice of each letter or number(more lines to practice on).

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: As a teacher there is nothing more difficult then writing! Especially when you have 28+ in your classroom. I have searched for writing material and this is a great beginning tool for PreK and Kindergarten. I use this for my morning work or Fundations (part of our ELA program) unit for practicing on how to write. It gives them a better idea on where to start and really practice that

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: This is a wonderful workbook that approaches early learning of letters and numbers from several angles. Children not only learn to write and recognize letters and numbers, they also learn foundational concepts that support the next level of learning. All this well thought out information wrapped up in fun! This book is a win-win! Highly recommend!
titles: Engaging workbook filled with lots of activity

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: Exactly want I wanted. It’s simple and has tons of handwriting exercises. It still has pictures and other activities to keep it some what interesting for the kids

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: Bought this for my granddaughter to practice her letters. This is a great book for learning to write letters and numbers.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: I bought this for my grandchild I was little disappointed with it it wasn't what I expected it was more for an older child

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: My 3 year old LOVES to write! This is perfect! It’s helping him form his letters and numbers with the lines guidance!

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: This has been awesome. The only thing I was disappointed by was the book wasn’t that big. But over all it’s been awesome and my son loves it.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: Great book! I laminated it, so we can re-use it. Has lines, shaped, numbers and abcs. Highly recommend it!

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: These are the ones my husband used as a child, so he knew they would be useful. They helped him a lot when he was learning to write and we will buy more of these moving forward as our son fills them with his first writings.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: The print is pretty big. I love the colors and images in the workbook. I just wish the print was a bit smaller so my son can practice more with tracing.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: A great book for a pre schooler to start on and learn everything even to write! I have a 2 year old and a 3 year old and this book helps alot!

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: Using this booklet with my 4-year old grandson to play school and at the same time learning how to print and follow simple directions!

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: My grandson took to this book right away. It's bright and engaging. We were very happy with the purchase.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: Our 5-yr old enjoys doing his "homework" (as he calls it) ... great product especially now that we're all stuck at home teaching our kids.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: My son loves this book. This book is very simple and exciting for the kids who are beginners to write. I can see a lot of improvement while practice tracing in this book. I highly recommend this book!

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: Perfect for kids, very good quality. But my 3 yr old son hardly uses is. Can’t wait for him to write in this book. Love it!

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: Wonderful for home schooling, My kids school closed and this was a fun way to do preschool at home.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: Had the book not even 24 hours and kept both my boys entertained for hours. Highly recommend.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: My wGrandson absolutely loved it

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents:
I think the workbook is straightforward. It is educational similar to school. There aren’t too many games/puzzles or “fun” pages. Depending on your child they might require something more interactive. Introducing them to tracing and learning the shapes are probably the funnest part of the book. The book is divided into three sections: shapes, letters, and numbers. Each section has different page border colors: purple, orange, and pink. I think it is nicely organized and sectioned. There are 84 pages. Letters have the most pages since there are 26 alphabet letters. The book goes in numerical/alphabetical order.

One thing I thought was a little strange is the writing style of some of the letters. It is different from how I write but maybe this is the easiest way to teach kids. It’s been too many years for me to even remember how my school taught me. Maybe it was the same way as this book but I just don’t write like that anymore. The letters I noticed are capital M, N, and W (If allowed, I will provide photos with my review).

There’s a certificate of completion at the end of the book. That’s cute and rewarding for the kids!

Age Range: 3 to 5 years
Grade Level: Preschool to Kindergarten

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents:
This workbook takes a no-nonsense approach to letter writing—written more like a school text book than other workbooks we’ve used in the past that incorporate fun formats. It also doesn’t begin with easy forming letters (Like E, T, F, or I)—Ms. Radke presents letter instruction in true alphabetical sequence, and suggests writing patterns on the top of each alphabetical page. Some suggestions conflict with the way traditional printing is taught (or was taught to me). Most people write W’s by slanting down, slanting up, slanting down, and then slanting up again—all in one fluid stroke. This workbook does not suggest that same stroke pattern, and I don’t know why. In those few instances, we simply ignore the given instructions, and follow formats that are more traditional and fluid. Practicing numbers one through ten is also included in this book.

We’ve gone through many workbooks with our other children. While this one does teach letter writing basics, it doesn’t incorporate much kid appeal like some other book sources do (Kumon series comes to mind). Learning can be fun and educational—this one seems to miss the mark in that department.
titles: Teaches Letter-Writing Basics But Not In A Fun, Engaging Way

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents:
My son (5) has been struggling with making his letters. It s something that came easily to his sister so his frustration level has been mounting (teacher "Oh, look how nice your sister writes, why can't you do this?" didn't help) I got this book to give him the opportunity to practice independently of his sister.
Yes, I know you can print these online, and I have. But my son REALLY likes having his own book to pull out and tackle. The cover is thick cardboard and the pages are heavy stock paper. The binding is nice and we haven't had any problems with pages falling out even with pressing it flat.
The book covers shapes, all the letters (taught with upper and lower case together like they do in school now), and numbers. There are simply photographs on each page without a lot of "clutter" so the actual practice space is maximized. One thing I really like are the little arrows and numbers to tell the child how to make the letter. My son INSISTS on starting at the bottom of the letter, this book helps him remember to start at the top most of the time, although I did find that going through and adding a little "start" dot helped even more. There is also a certificate of completion at the back of the book which my son is excited to earn and put on the fridge.
If you're looking for a practice book that focuses on letter formation without a lot of fluff, this is the book for you. I recommend it wholeheartedly!
titles: Good workbook for the preschool or kindergartner in your life

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents:
I think this book is amazing!

We (more like I) decided that our toddler has a lot of amazing skills and a very smart little one so instead of allowing him to use a tablet, I want him to learn and practice his skills with paper/crayons or whatever he has available.

The book allows them to practice these skills by first introducing the lines, squiggly lines, shapes, upper case and lower case letters as well as numbers.

I will say that based on the age, level and skills of your child; they might go through the whole book pretty quick. I don't think that is necessarily bad, I just think the more practice they get, the better.

I am trying to teach our little one to write his own name; he is capable of writing the A but other letters, he still has no idea how (even though he can recognize them).

I think the book serves as a guide for the adult as well; at least for those of us who want to help them learn but feel clueless as to how to go about it in a way that they find interesting.

Definitely worth it to me!

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: My son is three. He has colored. He has not tried to write. I thought this book would be great. He did not understand the whole tracing idea. I feel like there should be a little more of an introduction into writing. There are two pages for each letter of the alphabet and then practice pages for numbers. I really appreciate the section on handwriting strokes with straight and curvy lines, but there is only one page of straight lines and a couple pages of the others. I wish this section was bigger. I do not understand the purpose of the shapes tracing pages. My son can already draw shapes. If they are supposed to be helpful in learning how to form letters, put those first, and then the stroke practice, and so forth.
titles: Too advanced for "my first learn-to-write workbook"

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents:
I got this for my 5 year old , to provide her a structured supplemental resource for learning to write. She has typically not shown a bunch of interest in the alphabet (numbers more so), and I want her to have a variety of tools/activities.

For that purpose, this works well. It is cleanly designed/easy to read, but still has pops of color, including color photographs throughout. The emphasis here is on developing comfort making the required lines and shapes used in print writing. There are activities (some pictured above) that have the child trace non-alphabetic images, with the intent of making them more comfortable with these writing motions/shapes, etc. I think that's pretty cool. I have not compared this to other similar books, so I must admit I don't know how this stacks up. BUt it's a fair price, is reasonably engaging enough to keep my child's interest for the length of a session, and includes plenty of practice pages to work with.
titles: A Fun and simple Practice Book

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents:
This book is full of great exercises for your toddler as he/she learns to write. The patterns are well presented, and are fun to do.

Each page is different, and unless you want to buy about 50 copies of this book, you need to make copies of each page and use them to practice on.

My grandson is three and has been demanding to be taught to write and read. This has been a wonderful tool to help him get to where he wants to be. We sit down for short sessions, and he loves it.

I used to teach Kindergarten through second grade, and this is a very nice learning tool that would have been useful in my classroom.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: This workbook is perfect for preschoolers and up. My son just turned three and we have been doing activities similar to these for months now. He looks forward to doing them and having them in a nice workbook vs. single printouts has been awesome! He loves looking through his past work and it’s helpful to compare his work and see the improvements. He also really enjoys moving on to the next page so he gets much satisfaction from finishing a page. This workbook is definitely much nicer than what you can find in some stores these days, therefore I think it’s worth every penny! I would definitely recommend this workbook!!

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents:
My First Learn to Write Workbook has been very useful. My 4.5 year old is enjoying learning to write and do his own “lessons” as he watches his older sister have hers (we homeschool). The pros I have for this book are that it is colorful, engaging, offers arrow guides, opportunities to practice, and a certificate for when the workbook is completed. The only con I have is that it is in alphabetical order. I would prefer to have had the easier letters to practice first in order to help my son gain strength and dexterity in working up to the more difficult letters. We have been skipping around some for this purpose. Otherwise, we are very pleased with this book.

I received a complimentary copy of this book from Callisto Books in exchange for my voluntary and honest review.
titles: Useful for pre-k to lower elementary

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents:
My First Learn to Write Workbook by Crystal Radke is a delightful workbook for the 3+ yo. This is a book to help with fine motor skills with activities such as follow the lines, paths and drawing shapes. Then you can help your child with learning their numbers and letters.
This book also helps with coordination and how to hold and use a pen/pencil. I love the colorful pages with practice pages for so many letters and numbers. I think that even though a 3-year-old has a limited attention span, this is a book that will be beneficial nevertheless. For the older child, this book is perfect. I don't have any little ones anymore but I do have a grandson who is 3 now so I think that this book is perfect for him.
I received a copy of the book for review purposes only.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: My oldest has slight dyslexia, and for now we've been identifying which letters he is having problems with. For now it's lower case "b"s and "d"s, and also "S"s. So these are what we mainly focus on, sometimes leading to frustrations. So we figured that with this book we could disguise are intent and tell em it's to get a leg up on next year. Which is also true. So every week night this summer, we had a "homework" night and we would do a section from this writing book and a section from a reading book we got them. Both boys would work together to finish as fast as possible and get back to the video games. Their writing got a little better and hopefully they retained what they learned. So if you're having troubles with your little one, it doesn't hurt to get this book and sit down with them, and try to figure it out. Definitely wouldn't leave it up to the schools to do it.
titles: A must have for kids who struggle with writing can even help with dyslexia.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents:
My mom was very involved in my schooling, especially in the first couple of years to ensure that I had a good foundation and the start of the school was seen as positive. This book can be used by parents to assist parents when they look for ways to get their kids excited about writing and want to support them in their first year of schooling. With a variety of approaches, the book enables parents to help kids with learning to write and also makes learning to write an activity that can be done outside of school. I am not sure that the book makes these exercises necessarily fun, but knowing what difficult time my mom had finding book to help her get me started with writing, since I was a lefthander and she was writing with her right hand, this book bridges an important gap when parents look for books to help kids with school.

I received a free copy from the publisher.
titles: Putting parents in a position to assist their children with writing

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents:
I absolutely love this workbook.
I have been looking for something this for a while with no success. I even requested something similar from family members in Mexico, since I remember having one as a child.
I have a 3yo son and I absolutely love the way this workbook starts super easyyyyyy.
With a tracing vertical lines, then horizontal, then squiggly, trying to get children to get used to tracing as well as developing the necessary motor skills, then it moves into the more difficult stuff like letters and numbers.
We haven’t gotten that far yet.
What I’m doing is making a copy of each page and using copies for practice over and over!

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: A workbook designed to help kids feel comfortable holding writing utensils, learning to trace, and learning their letters and shapes. Filled with nice thick pages that won't bleed through and nice spaced out sections, this workbook is truly designed with kids in mind. Each letter is accompanied by the numerical pattern (point 1 to 2, etc) as well as some cute pictures of objects and animals that begin with that letter. Upper case and lower case letters are present as are numbers. At the end of the book there is even a cute little certificate you can cut out to celebrate your child's accomplishment!

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: My First Learn to Write Workbook is really a good workbook; I am actually impressed with the quality of the book. My little grandson had fun doing the pages. He was so proud to show me his work. He found it fun and interesting. I liked the structure of the assignments. For example, a picture of a car is shown, then beside it are what looks like a road with dotted lines to follow for it's path. Thus making the curved shape used in many letters, or a zig zag pattern. This helped him improve his skill in learning to hold the pencil and stay in the lines. I am looking forward to more workbook adventures with him.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: I got this for my 5yo to practice in as he works to improve his reading and writing in Kindergarten. I find it useful, and like the addition of pictures and words that start with the letter, as we're working on "beginning sounds" a lot. The one problem I have with the book is that this sort of binding is not very useful for a workbook. It would be better if it had a spiral binding, or some other sort of lay flat binding. We have to rip pages out in order for our child to be able to write on them comfortably. He just doesn't have the coordination yet to hold a book open while he writes.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: This is a great first writing workbook. The pages are thicker so it’s easier to turn the pages without ripping. This also makes the starter able to write hard and/or erase without putting a hole in the page. The book starts out with the basics; straight lines, curved lines, intersecting lines, etc before moving on to upper and lowercase letters as well as numbers. It includes the letter as well as dotted lines to trace. The size of the letters is that with which they would do on a Kindergarten writing sheet. The bright book catches their attention. A good quality workbook for preschoolers

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: SHE LOVES IT WHEN I SEND HER BOOKS...SO ABOUT EVERY TWO WEEKS I SEND HER SOMETHING...SHE LIVED WITH US FOR 4 YEARS AND THEN HER MOTHER JUST MOVED AWAY AND NOW IT IS NOT AS OFTEN WHEN I SEE HER,,,THIS LETS HER KNOW THAT I THINK OF HER, AND THAT OLD PAP LOVES HER...THANKS AMAZON FOR HELPING ME...

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: This book is great for little ones!! My 4 yo loves this!! So much so that my 2 yo wants one and I will be getting one for him too! Preschool teachers/homeschool moms this would be great for school use too! Easy to follow and the illustrations are cute! I pretty much told him to connect the dashes lines and they picked up on it fast! At the end of the book there’s a certificate of completing the alphabet in writing and it makes it a fun reward for them to complete the book!
titles: Great book for preschoolers!! Teachers and home school moms this is a must!

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: I think this books is worth the price. It is very basic, which is actually great. I feel like a kid could be pretty seIf-directed on this workbook. It's important for kids to work on pen control and this book doesn't feel really overwhelming. We can take it out work on a few pages, review letters and then come back to it. I received this book for free from the publisher.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents:
This book covers pre-writing, shapes, upper and lowercase, and number
practice. Helpful dots and arrows encourage proper formation. Solid and
dotted lines foster success for neatness. Full color illustrations invite
engagement. Empower your child with proper letter formation with this book!
titles: Empower your child with proper letter formation

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: My preschooler tore through this book. She loved tracing, there are big spaces for the kids to practice, not just little dotted lines. This gave her confidence to keep going and practicing. She was able to refresh her knowledge on letters and numbers. She loved it and it kept her busy for quite a while.

See pictures. Would recommend.

review_contents: This is the perfect First learning " learning" book. My daughter is almost 3 & a half and she lives this. My favorite part is the certificate in the back of the book. When she finishes it she will be excited to see that she got an award.

review_contents: I love everything about this book, my daughter is 3 1/2 years old and she loves it. She did the first 4 pages and got super excited. The book has everything that will help her trace better before returning to school.

product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: Ordered this book for my grandson. Received it and the book looks like it is very good for him to practice his printing during this Covid pandemic.
