product_name: My First Learn to Write Workbook: Practice for Kids with Pen Control, Line Tracing, Letters, and More! (Kids coloring activity books)
review_contents: My grandson who is almost there absolutely loves this book. I took packing tape and covered the pages with the clear tape so that he could do the page then have the pages wiped off and reused. He sits and works on his word/number copying for hours on end. Very educational and he’s learning every time he sits down to work on the book!!
review_contents

The problem with Amazon reviews is that some people are reviewing the content of the story while other people are reviewing the quality of the product, and they don't always match up.

The story, of course, is a classic. We had the Very Hungry Caterpillar as a board book from the time my kid was born until a cat hairballed on it a couple years later. I didn't replace it because I figured he was outgrowing board books anyway. However when we saw it as a paperback at his dentist's office a few weeks ago, he got so excited that I realized we need to own it again.

The actual book however, didn't have the pages cut or holes punched where the caterpillar eats through the foods. That's always been a defining feature of this book so it's just not the same. I'm returning it and will have to try again from an actual store where I can flip through it first.
titles: I guess the caterpillar wasn't that hungry

review_contents:
I have always been a fan of Eric Carle books, and we have the whole series, included the Very Hungry Caterpillar! 
My husband and I decided to accompany the book with its teether Rattle for our little one when he was 4 months old because we thought he would enjoy the reading time of this book more... we were right.
He has loved the book and his rattle too. He loved let the toy caterpillar eat the pages while I was reading for him and put his little fingers in the holes.
The illustrations are so unique and eye catching, the colors are bright, the pages are sturdy and the story holds his attention.
This book, like the others of Eric Carle, is interactive and rhythmic.
Children learn easily colors, the name of different fruits and foods and even counting how many are in each page. 
The book is small so it's easy to hold for a baby/toddler and very durable.
A must have
I'm upset that this is so small. My childhood book was like 4 times this size!

It's still awesome. This was my first book I read on my own as a child and likely contributed to my obsession with insects which turned into a major entomology hobby later on in life. While the basic idea of metamorphosis is presented well, obviously it's not totally accurate. However, my kids love this book anyway. Thanks to my entomological background, they grew up raising butterflies and moths, so they approach this book with familiarity and humor. All kids like the crazy food page too.
The format of the book was and will always be original and awesome. This book teaches days of the week, metamorphosis, time concepts, counting, it's kinesthetic and it's short...
Every kid should have this book
titles: Excellent when I was little and even better now that I'm older.

review_contents: Eric Carle's book has been a staple of children's literature for a long time. This board book is especially nice because it is so sturdy and will hold up to use by the smallest child. This book is one of my favorites to give as a new baby gift. The colors are vibrant, and there are many interesting pictures and opportunities for the young reader and parent to engage when looking at the book.

my son is obsessed with this book, (he's 2) and he even sleeps with it. He loves the "bug-gy" (maybe some day he'll say 'caterpillar') but for now bug-gy is just fine.
The book is the story of a very hungry caterpillar who eats and eats and eats some more, and then sleeps in a cocoon (or a "cackoon" as my son says) and wakes up and emerges as a beautiful butterfly.
The book is short, but fun for littles.
Recommended 100%

My baby loves loves loves this book! He is 2 and really likes the pictures of the different foods with the holes. It makes him laugh and smile and he loves saying the names of the different foods. He constantly pulls this book out to read. We have a lot of fun with him. It just gets him excited. I think every baby needs this book.
titles: A Fun Adorable Book and Educational

review_contents: As godmother of a two-year-old, I do a lot of reading aloud, and this is the favorite book of both of us. She is rapt through reading after reading, and I still like it myself. Part of the fun is exaggerating the voice when reading ". . . and he was still hungry!". It has totally escaped her notice that she is learning her numbers. I also recently purchased another copy for the 18-month-old daughter of a friend, and he reports she is crazy about it, too.

This is a much smaller version of the book than I expected (though I’m sure the dimensions of the book are listed under the description, I just didn’t think about how small that’s be) so it might be a good version for a small child, but it’s certanily not the normal size & not big enough to hold and read to a group of children. But still the cute same story and great price!

Note: Shipping was fast but whoever delivered it tried too hard to stuff it in my small community mail box and I almost ruined the book attempting to get it out (which obviously has nothing to do with the product but I’ve been very unhappy with the condition I’ve been receiving Amazon packages in lately.)
titles: Very small (not normal size) maybe works for babies

review_contents: I was very disappointed in my purchase. I was reading the book to my son and when I got to the last page it was printed upside down/a copy of the page before. I REPEAT...NOT THE COMPLETE BOOK. Save you money people.

I got this book for my 16 month old daughter. A friend had it for her son, and I just needed to have it. The book is perfect, the colors are bright and beautiful. We love it! There are no flaws, the quality is incredible. 100/100 recommend! The illustrations are adorable, and the story is too cute.

Since last Christmas I've been looking for more miniature books to give as presents to the children in our family. The Board Book is the perfect size for kids so they can hold the book themselves - some kids are very independent! The Board Book Version of this story is the one you want if you want to see through the pages. The first six pages are hole punched and line up perfectly.

The story itself is about a little caterpillar who is very hungry. The rest of the story is about which types of foods he tries to eat to satisfy his hunger. There are pictures of apples, pears, plums, strawberries, oranges and then...I laughed as I turned the page and saw the long list of foods this poor caterpillar tried to eat. But the story ends happily with the caterpillar turning into a beautiful butterfly.

This is going to be a great Christmas present. As an adult I even enjoyed reading it.

~The Rebecca Review

I don't think I'd read this book until I decided to get it for my son. I knew it was popular, but didn't know much about it otherwise. Now that we have it, I don't really love the story...it's not that great to read aloud (doesn't rhyme, no fun words, etc.). It may be better for older children, but it's not one of my favorites to read to him at this age (1-1.5 yrs). I also don't love the illustrations because it's hard for him to learn/recognize objects given the somewhat abstract/artsy drawings.

However, my son *LOVES* the die cuts - he's obsessed with them. So, it gets 5 stars from him for the uniqueness of the pages/holes in the pages, and 4 stars from me because even though he likes it (thumbs up!), the story is lackluster and illustrations that are too abstract for a toddler (thumbs down).

From what I can tell, buying this item New is the only way to go if you want the stuffed caterpillar with it. All the sellers I contacted here and on eBay about buying it used said the stuffed caterpillar was not included. (Which doesn’t surprise me, since I don’t expect the caterpillar to last long before it’s torn, dirtied, or lost in my house.)

All that said, my 4 year old LOVES his big sized book with the caterpillar. I gave it to him for Christmas and he was thrilled. The Very Hungry Caterpillar has been his selected bedtime story for the past few months and the novelty of the big version will probably last a few months from now.
titles: Don’t buy used and expect the plush to come with it

review_contents: Got both the hardcover and board book versions . . . hardcover much better to read, larger words and beautiful illustrations on glossy thick paper, good quality . . . board book version is much smaller, words are tiny, illustrations still vibrant, kept this because thought it would hold up better in hands of 1 yr old ... also, kept the hardcover to read as baby learns how to treat pages gently.
titles: Great book for learning colors & numbers ... beautiful illustrations, good quality

review_contents: This was my absolute favorite book many moons ago when I was a little girl. I was thrilled to find it for my 13 month old Granddaughter Averie. I honestly think I liked the book I had which hap paper pages, but, with this being a “board book” I think it will hold up better to being handled by a toddler. I am so excited to be sharing a book that brings back fond memories for me with Averie.
titles: My favorite book from when I was young

review_contents: I loved this book as a child and I love this author so much. However I don't like the quality of the book or how small it is. A book is a book but as a child I remember it so what different. I still love the author I just hate the way it was made all tiny oh well.

This was one of my favorite books as a child, and now it has become my son's! He loves the colorful artwork and seeing how much the caterpillar eats before he turns into a beautiful butterfly! Some books are compromised when they are turned into board books, but not this one.

Great book. Timeless story. This hard cover book is more interactive with holes cut out of pages to demonstrate the very hungry caterpillar's huge appetite! One of my childhood favorites. Glad to see this classic is still available. Great quality hard cover book will last as part of your childrens' book collection.

This was one of my favorite books as a child. Such nostalgia! I love how each page is different lengths with the hole through it, where the caterpillar has eaten through the yummy food - and to end with a beautiful butterfly. So sweeeet! So happy to get this at a great price online, quick delivery and now creating memories for another little one.
titles: Loooooooooooove this book and am gifting one now

review_contents: The board book arrived in excellent, new condition. This was my favorite book as a kid, and I was told I memorized it to "read" to people when I was 3 years old. I gifted it to my baby nephew. It's a cute book about a caterpillar that eats a lot of colorful foods before turning into a beautiful butterfly. It's not repetitive or too basic which I appreciate especially for a kids book!

LOVE this book. I had a paperback copy as a child, but my little one was a bit rough on paper pages and I didn't want my childhood copy to get ruined, but also didn't want my child to not get to hear/read one of my all time favorite stories. It has withstood so far, with the exception that the jacket comes off, which isn't unexpected or unusual.

This book was classic in my childhood, and now that I am trying to explain to my toddler that butterflies start as caterpillars this was an obvious choice. This particular verison is a smaller book then the original it is still the complete story just more compact but its a perfect fit for my 2 year old. At $5.79 you cant go wrong.

Perfect size. My 4-year old “reads” this over and over! The patterned phrasing helps him to memorize the words. Highly recommend. Also, watching the YouTube video of this book several times in the past prior to buying the book was helpful to reinforce the language and make connections.

I discovered this book while employed as a teacher with a post-grad qualification of "Early Education Specialist" in Scotland. Have purchased and recommended this wonderful book as gifts/delightful teaching tools on innumerable occasion; on several continents (including the U.S.) Always met with interest and enjoyment.
titles: The most clever and educational, early education delight

review_contents: Very bad. It broke the first time she put her little hands on it and fell to the floor. I know I missed the return date by 2 days; however I feel I was deceived by the advertisement and it should not have been made of material that would break. Is there anyway I can receive a refund.

I had been reading a few other Eric Carles to my 3 yr old and told him about this book. He became obsessed with wanting to read it and after not being able to find it at the library, I decided to just buy it. He loves it. Glad I bought it because we can read it as much as we want and keep it for as long as we want. Came on time and in perfect shape.
The binding on the book is broken. The first tine a toddler “reads” it, the book will fall apart.

This book is amazing. My son ask to read it everyday. I could even get him go to bed early by telling home we gonna read the book. He even remembers the order of caterpillar eats the food and number! I wish I have got this book earlier!
titles: My son reads it every day

review_contents:
This is a great little book to have fun with your child. We learned it by heart and read it until the pages tore free. We have the other books in the series, but the Hungry Little Caterpillar is the best.

Glad I got it!

Great read as it makes counting and learning about food/fruit very interactive. I wished the caterpillar was illustrated a little larger but the holes he made eating his way through pages to butterflydom were brilliant! My 3yo loves animals and saying the word caterpillar!

Not much to say about this book other than the quality of it is durable, and the colors are vibrant just like the pictures.

It feels great to know that I can share one of my favorite childhood stories with my toddler, who absolutely loves it.
I read this book to her as I play the animated video of the book, it delights her to compare the book to the movie. She even makes “nom-nom” sounds when he eats, it’s her favorite bedtime story!

This book was one of my childhood favorites and now I bought it for my son. I love the colors and the book is fun. We have read it multiple times before bed. I am very glad this is a board book because he likes to chew on the pages since he is 8 months old.

We had originally bought this book for my little girl about 2 years ago. She still loves reading this book. It's very short, so it was able to keep her attention. She also liked counting the different foods the caterpillar ate. It's a very simple, classic children's book perfect for young children. Since my daughter loved it so much, I bought this one for my niece and hope she loves it too!

I love this book it is one of my favorites but I was disappointed when it opened the book and it did not have the flip pages that reveal the next fruit of the day . My kids were confused and kept counting the vegetables from the day before . My purpose was to use it as book a counting but I had to keep explaining that they don’t count the first group they just count the second group.

It’s a great story. We all know that. The book itself, as an object, isn’t so great. The paperboard isn’t very sturdy and I’m just not ok with the fact that it’s printed in China. Inevitably my daughter will chew on a corner of it at some point and I don’t like the thought of her investing low quality Chinese ink with lead and who knows what else in it. I’d gladly pay several dollars extra for books printed domestically.

Love this author and this story. The board book version is awesome, interactive, colorful, and fun. Had to buy a second one so my granddaughter could have one for home! She loves putting her finger on each little hole the Caterpillar chews!
Bought this among other toys as a donation for LA Children’s Hospital is memory of our nephew. My sister-in-law commented on how cute all the items were and how proud she was to donate them.
This is a great hard page book, but it is small in size, which is nice and portable, but I was surprised by the smaller version, still OK, stiff pages great for little ones....
Do not get this if you are wanting the full book. It is a cardboard book of the original and small. Missing most of the pages from the original. It was great quality just not what I was looking for.
I bought this book many years ago for my niece and now getting it for my grand nephew. I love these books. I highly recommend reading them to your children or grand children.
titles: A must read to your children

review_contents: My son loves to talk about caterpillar and this boardbook was a perfect gift for him. Try checking out this book from a local library to see if your kids like the story and if yes, this would be a great boardbook to include in your book collection!
titles: A perfect gift for babies/toddlers who love catercaterpillars!

review_contents: Purchased this book because it was listed as one of the top recommended books for babies/young children in an article discussing that children prefer books that teach them how and why the world works the way that it does. We love the story and depictions are funny to see too! Highly recommend!
Thought book would be normal size but it came tiny.

This is a seriously cute little book. The colors are appealing to children, and the holes on the pages that they can count are something that children enjoy as well. Be sure you pay close attention to the measurements of the one you buy. This was not as large as one I had bought before. And while it is a handy size that can be easily tucked into purse or diaper bag, I was not expecting it to be a smaller version of one I had bought before.
titles: A cute story that small children really love

review_contents: I feel really impressive by its quality and content. PERFECT for my 17month old boy who started to know how to say some fruits and food
Bought this book as a gift. My only complaint is that it is small. When I purchased, I thought I was buying the full size hardback book; this book is hardback but it is a small one.
My 2 year old granddaughter loves this book. I bought it for her several months ago. She always goes to it. Over and over and over again. It is just a fun, learning to count book. Can't go wrong.
Love all the Eric Carle books. This is a new favorite for gbaby. Also being a board book will be great for her new baby sister!
Bought this book for a baby gift because it has been a favorite in our family for 40 years and it's just full of wonder now as it was then!!

I recently ordered this book for my student's little sister. This is such a classic and little ones seem to enjoy it very much! This came as a board book, which is easy for little hands to hold. It was wrapped in plastic when it arrived. Very happy with my purchase!
Got this as a gift and have heard no complaints. I remember reading this book while growing up and I always enjoyed it.

Purchased this as a gift. This is one of my favorite books to read at home to my littles. We always enjoy this book so I wanted to pass one along. It is your typical board book that is sturdy enough to take the roughness of toddler hands. We will continue to pass this favorite along to our friends and loved ones.

The quality of the book is extraordinary good. This is probably the only book we have in decent condition due to its high strength pages. The storyline and the structure of the book is really good and interesting for the toddlers.
Great Eric Carle story with the life cycle of a caterpillar to butterfly. (Although strange foods are consumed too.) A classic and well loved at our house.
Bought this for my three year old grandson and we read it every night. Great learning tool and beautiful colorful pictures

I was pleasantly surprised at the way they display the food the hungry caterpillar eats, it's so cute! My baby loves to poke her fingers in the little holes. It's a perfect size for a baby, travel, and storing on a book shelf. We love this classic book.
I always loved this book as a kid and I had to get it for a friend who is pregnant so she can read it to her baby. It's a classic and the board book is very good quality
It is very simple and easy. My daughter loves to put her tiny fingers in the holes. It has really grown on me.
My kid's favorite book, he wanted it back for his kids and I lost his copy so I bought a used one to hand off as his... seemed to work.

This classic book is great for toddlers. My 2 and 3 year old love the artwork, and watching the caterpillar 'crawl' through foods as we turn the inner pages.

If you're wondering whether or not your kids would enjoy it as much as you did, they will.
This is a mini version of the book I thought I was getting. Very disappointing.
This is a very cute little book. It arrived very fast & was a excellent price for a used . Plus it was in very good condition.
titles: Great choice for the little kiddos

review_contents: I think the title speaks for itself, but if it doesn’t, there are so many things you can teach your child. They can learn their numbers, types of fruit, colors, the changes from a caterpillar to a butterfly aka science. This is a must educational read for every child plus there are short cutout pages in the book for every day of the week.
Always a fun book. The art is fun, pretty and colorful. My one year old loves sticking her fingers in the “bite” holes. The different sized pages give it a unique and fun quality. Great book.

This is one of my son's favorite books and he's starting to receive it from memory (he's 19mo). He enjoys flipping the little pages in the first section and counting them with me for each day. I enjoy that it's not flimsy and he can rough grab it like toddlers do and it doesn't break. It has held up quite nicely to my stinky baby.
Who doesn’t love this classic children’s book!? I love that it’s a board book and that it is small. I have it in the diaper bag to pull out while we are waiting wherever we might be.
titles: Small, portable and a classic favorite

review_contents:
This is such a great gift.
My granddaughter is totally thrilled with this book, she can't get enough of it.
And it's made 100% as sturdy as the original, although it's a fraction of the size. It's just beautiful.
titles: Exactly Like The Beautiful Hard Cover Large Book, Just Smaller

review_contents: This is such a cute book I remember from when I was a kid reading this with my mom. I bought this for my infant son and we've already read it three times together. It seems pretty good quality and I think it's going to hold up well.

The book was perfect my sister had no idea I had gotten it. no double copies of a page and my nephews loved it they beg my sister to read them the story over and overs. It’s a sweet book that I’m glad I was able to pass on to my nephews, that lily sister and I grew up with. Amazing little hard book, very child friendly for them to handle.
Cute store and vibrant colors! The board book is strong and has survived my 2 year old! Not many books do! She loves the interactive parts and learning the fruits in it as well!
This little board book version of The Very Hungry Caterpillar is vibrant, sturdy, and beautiful--all while being perfectly sized for small hands. My son loves it (and can't destroy it yet).
titles: Fantastic edition of this classic book

review_contents:
This book is well made. It holds a child’s attention.
My daycare children enjoyed this reading!!!!
The illustration is superb!!!!

Quality is fine, what you would expect. My son is obsessed with this book, he is turning 5 and has the book memorized, it's his pick nightly. He now has a hungry caterpillar stuffed animal and weighted blanket as well. I'm started to think he may have a problem, some sort of caterpillar addiction of sorts.
titles: Quality is fine, what you would expect

review_contents: My 4 yr old loves the book and now it's on his tablet cuz he ordered it accidentally!! I changed my Amazon settings so he could no longer buy anything with a click!
titles: This book got my child to try new foods!

review_contents:
I purchased the board book version, which is the one you want if you want to recreate your childhood experience. Yes, it's a small book, it's for toddlers.

It's exactly what I expected it to be and I know my toddler will love it :)
All time favorite!! A very popular classic!! Had it as a part of my library as a young children teacher. Now we have it on my newborn daughter ‘s library and we read it every day!!

This book arrived quickly and was just as the seller described. One of my favorite books for little ones to focus on pointing to pictures (the holes in the picture are perfect), vocabulary (foods, hungry, full, days of the week) and sequencing.

Absolutely one of the favorite books of my grandchildren. Helping them to identify figures, fruit vegetables and objects. As well as learning the life cycle of a beautiful butterfly. They go back to this book time and time again.
titles: A Great and Exciting Learning Book/Tool for Children

review_contents: I read this book to my 2 and 5 year old children and they love it. They have practically memorized it. My 2 year old loves putting her index finger in the holes and count.

One of my favorites growing up and I started reading this to my son when he was 4 months old. He still asks for this as a toddler and we've been through 3 copies having worn out the copies. Great book and highly recommended.
titles: Great book for babies and toddlers

review_contents: One of my sons favorite books. Baby shower gift.

This book brings my memory back to my elementary days. My first grade teacher Ms. Lee. I remember every time before she reads a book to us. She pass out gummy bears. Whenever I saw this book, it reminds me of gummy bears..lol.

This was my most cherished book as a toddler. The only reason why I didn’t give this specific version 5 stars is cuz the best part (pull-out pages with holes in them where the caterpillar’s supposed to “eat” through) wasn’t there. Regardless, classic & colorful story for children!
The fabric was very good quality. Week days and what the caterpillar ate on each day was printed multiple times on the fabric. I made a Quillo out of it for my great-grandson and he loved it.
titles: The Very Hungry Caterpillar - great story!

review_contents: My granddaughter loves this book! The format is very cute for young children and the story is adorable! The illustrations are beautiful and so colorful! We love Eric Carle's Books! Thank you so much! Frances Carol Laronga (kalola0602@yahoo.com)
titles: The format is very cute for young children and the story is adorable! The illustrations are beautiful and so colorful

review_contents:
(This review is Specific to the Hardcover Giant version priced around fifty dollars, but it will be grouped due to this sites issues with all Hungry reviews)

I just purchased the Giant Hardcover version of this excellent classic now in its 40th year. It came in a beautiful, beautiful big box with lovely thick glowing pages, a treasure for a classroom. (The only negative might be that I have to repeatedly do this from my own pocket with California continuing to disgrace public education in its lack of funding and the national sideshow to keep teacher's pounded while they do exactly that, get what they need out of their teacher's pocket, most often with no thanks. Or worse while treating them disrespectfully. However it's just to be expected now I suppose.)

That said this is just beautiful.
It is a book about transformation. I am a 1st grade teacher delighted to be able to use it as I develop lessons for my class. What is happening, of course, is that they are taking the stories read to them not long ago and then reading them to one another and beginning their journey into literacy with books like this. It is, as Carle said in a tape I own of him discussing his book making, of his making, easing the journey from home to school, making it more comfortable and a better experience.

This story of the caterpillar munching away teaches on so many levels, formal and informal- from love of color, to fascination with the holes( the gimmick if you will), from the life cycle of this butterfly, to the days of the week, the idea of change...it's rich with possibilities and spawned the idea for derivative books my class is making this week and many joyful moments acting out and reading the text.

Who might want such a big book?
It's a great thing to donate to a primary teacher, I'd have loved it when my children were young, it might be a really exciting gift to a family with several youngsters 1 to 7 in age that might enjoy a really exciting special big gift, something that celebrates books, perhaps combined with a butterfly kite. Carle is among my favorite writers for younger children, and make no mistake, what appears simple and so easy is the product of someone that has done their personal work to a very high level. This is without a doubt a classic! The Very Hungry Caterpillar by Eric Carle is a book that my mom read to me pre- kindergarten. I recently picked it up in a bookstore and was amazed at how it still brought back the feeling of wonder at the mysteries of nature. No, it is not meant to be a factual text that teaches scientific concepts to preschoolers -- neither are fairy tales and nursery rhymes, but I don't hear anybody saying they were disappointed in the lack of accuracy of Mother Goose! Instead, this delightful little gem does something much more valuable; it sparks interest and a sense of wonder. That is something only the best books are capable of.

NOTE: This review is of the Touch & Feel Picture Books edition which includes text in Braille.

This edition is a Dreaming Fingers product by Karadi Tales Company (which appears to be located in India, based on the company's website and the publication information in the book). The ISBN number is 81-8190-083-9, and the book measures about 13" by 10" in size. There is no Braille on the cover of the book.

Inside the book, every page (except the copyright information) - including the title page and dedication page - has Braille text, and all illustrations are made completely out of textured materials. The textures are distinct enough that by touching the pictures, one can fairly easily discern all the details of what is being illustrated. For example, the first page of the story starts with text that reads "in the light / of the moon / a little egg / lay on a leaf." The text has Braille superimposed on it. Beside the text, the illustration begins - one textured material making up the sky background, another textured material making the soft leaf, and yet another material on top of that making the bump of the little egg. So by touching the pages, one can both read the story and feel the illustrations without seeing anything.

The textured illustrations are very well made with an excellent variety of materials. Some of the edges of illustrations that were made of cloth had a tiny bit of unraveling around the edges (but nothing serious), and the antenna of a caterpillar on one page came loose in my copy, but overall the quality of the illustrations and their textured materials is quite good. The variety of textures used is far superior to most "touch & feel" books. I counted at least 20 different kinds of materials used, including twine, flannel, pipe cleaner, burlap, satin, and leather. The book appears to be something that would hold up over time and withstand a fair amount of rubbing as one explores the illustrations by repeatedly touching them.

The story includes the full text; this is not an abbreviated version. Even the pages with the foods are in the same format as the original edition and include the little hole in each food.

I believe that even children who are able to see the pictures would thoroughly enjoy this edition of the book with its creative manner of allowing the reader to interact more in depth with the story through touch.
titles: Touch & Feel Braille Edition: the best illustrative version of this book!

review_contents: Great book
Such a wonderful classic! Love this book!

“This early work by a premier author marked an exciting breakthrough in the traditional children’s book format. Carle uses clever cutout pages to depict a caterpillar eating his way through the calendar week. Caterpillar also brilliantly displays Carle’s ability to integrate a concept (days of the week), scientific information (the life cycle of a caterpillar), and an appealing story. (Ages 3-6)” –
--Judith Rovenger, Sesame Street Parents, July/August 1994

“Carle's classic tale of a voracious caterpillar who eats his way through the days of the week and then changes into a beautiful butterfly has been reissued in a sumptuous twenty-fifth anniversary edition with a shiny, silver-coated cover and wonderfully thick, durably pages.”
--The Horn Book Guide Volume VI, Number 1 July-December 1994
“Every child should experience this wonderful, cumulative story, with its brightly coloured pictures of the tiny but greedy caterpillar that eats his way through one apple, two plums and three pears before turning into a beautiful butterfly. The board version stands up well to the inevitable poking of little fingers through the holes in the pages.” (2-4 yrs)
--Kirkus UK

If this review was helpful please select the ‘yes’ button below
my kids love this book! it's also a book that I remember from my childhood.
Loved everthing about it

On the one hand, it's The Very Hungry Caterpillar - I love it (despite the upside-down butterfly on the last spread), I grew up with it, it's a great book.

On the other hand, I'm not sure it's a book very well-suited for board book format. The best feature of the book, the holes, are too small to be much fun, and the normal audience for board books is perhaps a little young to fully enjoy this one - it's too wordy without any narrative tricks (rhyme, meter, alliteration) to pull them in.

In retrospect, it would have been better to wait a few years and then just get the regular hardcover edition.
titles: Book is great, but the format may not be

review_contents:
My three-year-old twins received this book as a gift when they were newborns and we read it several times a week before bedtime. They never get tired of it! We have a few of Eric Carle's books besides this one but The Very Hungry Caterpillar is our favorite. The book tells the story about how a little caterpillar pops out of an egg and he is very hungry so he eats...and eats...and eats! At first he starts by eating one apple on Monday, then two pears on Tuesday,and so on but it isn't enough so each day he eats more and more until his stomach hurts because he ate too much. I won't spoil the ending because it's extremely cute and fun for my twins to look at.

We have the board book edition and it's held up extremely well over the past three years considering we are still on our first copy of it! The book measures seven inches by five inches and is a great size for small hands. There are 22 pages in the story which includes fun, beautiful pictures. Each set of pages has one or two sentences so it's a nice length for short attention spans. One thing that is really neat about this book is that since the caterpillar is eating through a number of foods, there are actual holes in the pages big enough for a finger so kids can have fun sticking their fingers through where the caterpillar has eaten. I also like the fact that during the first five days the caterpillar is eating one apple, two pears, three plums, etc. so we've also made this book into a counting story on occasion.

The Very Hungry Caterpillar is one of my kids' favorite bedtime books and they love for me to read it to them! We love it so much we ordered it as a baby shower gift for a friend and she was pretty excited to receive it. I love the board book edition because it's very durable and we are still on our first copy after three years of twins looking at it quite a bit which is saying a lot! I can't say enough good things about this book and feel it would make a great gift for all babies and young children. I highly recommend it!
titles: This is One of My Twins' Favorite Books!

Many have said what I'm about to say, but there's a few that disagree so I figured I'd throw my 2 cents in... just in case someone stumbles over my review. I BOUGHT THE BOARD BOOK, NOT HARDCOVER!

To start, I bought this book for admittedly odd reasons. My daughter is a "pig," she is about to have a butterfly party and I needed about $4 more to get free shipping. I knew of this classic, but didn't remember it.

SIZE/STYLE: It isn't a bad size at all!? It says 5x7 and I didn't measure it, but I think that's about what it is. Micro? Smaller than a dollar bill? No, but those reviews I saw were from 2009 on the hard cover version which is more money. So if it really was that small, yeah, rip-off! This one is just right for little hands and I actually prefer to buy board books because I don't like ripped pages!

STORY: I was very impressed with the learning of the book. Counting, days of the week, and what the caterpillar should be eating!

BOOK: I loved the little tabs in the book to bring the kids into it, and the holes in the pages like the caterpillar ate it!

Very happy with this purchase. Just over $5 for a classic book that had neat features for young kids!
titles: Better than Expected for the low price of a Classic!

I remembered always reading “The Very Hungry Caterpillar” when I was small and I have always loved the sweet nature of this book. I still love this book to this very day! “The Very Hungry Caterpillar” is a popular children’s book by Eric Carle and it is about how a very hungry caterpillar starts eating everything in its path. “The Very Hungry Caterpillar” is truly a cute and extraordinary book about food that children will love for many years!

Eric Carle has certainly done a great job at both illustrating and writing this book. What I really enjoyed about this book was Eric Carle’s illustrations as they are extremely colorful and cute. I love the way that Eric Carle illustrated the caterpillar having a green long body and a red head and Eric Carle also did a great job at putting a surprised expression on the caterpillar’s face when it first got out of its egg. I also love the illustrations of the caterpillar eating any food item that it comes across such as an apple and a piece of chocolate cake and you can see the cut out holes in the middle of the images of the food items indicating that the caterpillar ate through each food item. I definitely enjoyed Eric Carle’s story of the caterpillar as it details the caterpillar’s extreme hunger whenever it ate through so many food items. Eric Carle makes the story extremely cute and hilarious as the caterpillar literally eats twice its weight and I found myself laughing at the different types of food that the caterpillar ate. Many children will be awed at how much food the caterpillar, even I was surprised at how much food the caterpillar ate and I was not so surprised when the caterpillar had a stomachache, which will teach children about the importance of not overeating so much.
titles: ... Caterpillar” when I was small and I have always loved the sweet nature of this book

We had the paperback version of this classic story, but after a few years of frequent readings it was all torn and bent. I was so excited to find this story in board book format, so that we can read it repeatedly without worrying about tearing/bending the pages. The cardboard pages are thick and feature the holes through which the caterpillar ate. To make the story interactive, I made a small "caterpillar" out of pipe cleaners and as we read, she "feeds" him through the holes in the foods on the pages! It makes it so much more fun for her to read the story! The board book measures 7" x 5" and features the classic Eric Carle style tissue paper collage illustrations (note that is how he creates the look, there are no textured pages in this book).

The plot of the story takes you through the life cycle of a butterfly from egg to caterpillar to pupa to butterfly. I love how educational this story is and how perfect it is to initiate educational activities about butterflies with your child. We've read it so many times, but now that she's a bit older, we've created butterfly life cycle collages, done story sequencing activities with it, and we even purchased a live butterfly garden that allowed her to see how a real butterfly transforms Butterfly Garden Gift Set with Live Cup of Caterpillars. After the caterpillar emerges, he eats through a variety of foods before making a cocoon around himself and transforming into a butterfly.

We love this book and its educational value and highly recommend it!
titles: Beloved Classic Story, Lots of Educational Value for Older Kids, Love the Board Book Format

The book speaks for itself. It's a classic and kids love it. What I didn't realize from the picture, is that this particular board book is very large and has a handle which is integrated into the book. It also comes with a small plush hungry catapillar which is nice when reading the story to use to demonstrate the catapillar eating his way through the food, not to mention perfectly sized for little hands. I know the description states "giant board book and plush package" but again, the picture does not match the description so I was curious as to which item I would receive. I was looking for a large board book without the handle, because the handle is not very sturdy and arrived bent/damaged. I didn't bother contacting Amazon as with a few uses the handle will bend anyhow (and remain crinkled), hence the reason I was looking for a board book without the handle. I am pleasantly surprised by the little plush though :)

review_contents: Wonderful book to read to children!!!

It might not be quite as sturdy as the original, but the book I ordered seems to be the standard size that I originally purchased over...was it really 20 years ago? Now that I think about it, maybe we had the hardcover version. But, this paperback version will more than suffice. I remember my daughter jumping up and down on the bed, reciting every word of this book by heart. We read it together so many times that the pages began to shred. I'm looking forward to grandchildren, and want to make sure I can share this book with them too, and keep the family tradition going. I mean, who wouldn't love a Very Hungry Caterpillar who loves to eat salami? :)
titles: Exactly what I hoped for to replace our beloved book

review_contents:
This is my 4 and [...] favorite book. We have a little game, everytime we read about what the caterpillar ate "he ate 2 strawberries but he was still..." the boys yell "HUNGRY!" Or near the end of the story when we read about how the caterpillar wasn't little anymore, he was a..."BIG FAT CATERPILLAR" the boys yell again. It will be one of those mommy memories that will last until I'm all old and grey! My [...] especially loves this story and would read it over and over and over again in one day if I let him.

We purchased this book for my [...] niece this Christmas, and believe she will love it as much as my boys have. This particular version of the book is all board book, which is perfect for a great book like this which promises to be a favorite and will get lots of wear and tear.

On an educational note, I like how this book teaches young kids to count in a subtle way, as well as teaching them labels for different fruits and foods. This book is also a simply put book which teaches them about the metamorphosis of caterpillars and butterflies!
titles: Favorite book in our house, great condition!

This is a classic story that is very popular among children and schoolteachers. This book tells the story of a caterpillar who eats holes through various fruits and other food items. In the end, he turns into a butterfly. This is a simple story with few words. The illustrations are nice. There are holes in the pages where the caterpillar has eaten through the food item, which is a nice touch that amuses children. This can be used as a bedroom or nursery theme for a baby or child. Matching bedding and decor can be found at Pottery Barn or online. I used this hardcover book as a baby shower gift for a mother who chose this as her nursery theme. Each guest signed this inside cover or one of the pages with a permanent marker.
titles: A Classic! Makes a great nursery theme or gift!

review_contents: All time Classic

My daughter enjoys this book! So colorful and fun and this was my baby brothers favorite book at the time! Do recommend it’s great for bed time stories!

The story is captivating for a young child and explains the process of morphosis, changing from a caterpillar into a butterfly. I read the larger version to my children and they loved it, as it was hands-on interactive. They were able to slip a finger into a cloth tube that resembled the action of the caterpillar.

This mini book is too small, in my opinion, for them to enjoy it the same way. While it may be a great idea for a parent who wants something small for the diaper bag or car, it just isn't practical and the experience is diminished.

The larger version rates five stars.
titles: The Very Too-Small Book for Children Hungry for Big Pictures and Interactive Fun

I bought this story book for my two-year-old daughter. If you are looking to buy a book that has a classic story line and incredible artwork, this is the right book for you. I grew up reading this book so I knew for a fact that my two-year-old daughter would enjoy and appreciate this book just as much as I always have. If you are looking to buy this book, I would highly recommend that you purchase the board book version. The board book is much sturdier than the average hard cover or paper cover so it does not get easily damaged and destructed by a toddler. This is a fantastic book and story that never gets old. You will have no regrets when you order Eric Carle's classic tale of "The Very Hungry Caterpillar".

I never read this book to my own children. Somehow, we missed it. However, it became a great favorite in my grandson's library and we have read it time and time again. The cycle of life, from egg, to caterpillar to cocoon and finally butterfly is taken step by beautiful step. Carle's gentle humor makes the insect a personality filled with wonder at his own growth. Reading it together, I love to build the tension until the ending , when the cocoon changes into a wonderful new creature. We have a new love for our flying friends now, and have even grown our own butterflies. It was as wondrous as reading this book.
titles: it became a great favorite in my grandson's library and we have read ...

review_contents: One thing i would like to point out is that the books arrived damaged, other then that fast delivery.

Before my so was born I wanted to make sure I started a small library for him. When thinking of what books I wanted to get him I thought back to what books I enjoyed myself as a kid. One of the top three booked that popped into my head was "The Very Hungry Caterpillar". I have such fond memories of reading this book as a kid that! Such a cute story along with learning. The price I thought was very fair as I have seen it cost even more at Walmart. Shipping was quick (I didn't use two day shipping) and the packaging was great as well. The book itself was in excellent new condition and the sturdiness has held up strong against my 11 month olds roughness upon it. The colors are very vibrant and they really pop off the book! Definitely an A+ book that I would reccomend you adding to your little ones library! It would also make a great gift :)

When I bought this I was envisioning something similar to the small board books, that would be easy to grip by a baby, and where she could practice turning pages. That is not the case. I am very unhappy with the construction of this book.

The pages are very small, and hard to grip and turn by a baby. It is also very, very awkward to hold it open while reading because of the size, and also because it is simply hard to open. I have no explanation on why the book opens with difficulty. Finally, the corners are very sharp, and they've poked my daughter several times. The materials used in the miniature edition are not suitable for a baby book.
titles: The miniature edition has terrible construction and is hard to grip by a baby

"The Very Hungry Caterpillar" is one of my favorite interactive children's stories. I have adopted the tradition of buying classic children's stories and fairy tales to gift friends who are pregnant or have children of their own. Because of the popularity and relatively unchanged look of this story, it is considered a classic and can be quite expensive in book stores (hence, me buying this on Amazon.com). The book is available in several different formats but I always buy hardcover books for children as my hope is they will weather little hands. It has 32 pages with several half, third, and quarter pages as the caterpillar begins to eat through fruits and vegetables; bright, colorful illustrations, and a bound bead-board white cover (note: this cover can get dirty quickly!). The book is approximately 9" x 12" and has a wonderful message and story.
titles: Great for little hands that like to turn pages and interact with the story!

After perusing the reviews of the many formats of this cherished classic, I decided on the "Miniature Hardcover" as my choice and am ecstatic with the delivery! It is absolutely adorable! Yes, it is tiny, but it is an actual hardcover book (not a cheap abridged board book). It's cover is glossy and solid, with high quality pages that even contain the original holes in the pages that I remember being somehow captivated by when I was a child. This is one purchase where I am even more delighted with the result than I imagined. I still want a full size hardcover someday, but this one is absolutely a steal at Amazon's price, and the quality is appreciable. Great purchase!
titles: Beautiful: A Miniature Hardcover of the Full Sized Classic!

This book is simple, bun. My daughter loves it and often proclaims 'still hungwy!'. If you can find the book with the stuffed caterpillar, it's very cute. Definitely a must for all children.

The only complaint I have is one that most people will probably think I'm crazy for complaining about - a caterpillar spins a chrysalis around himself, not a cocoon. Cocoons are what moths (and certain other insects) spin.

So, when you read the book, be sure to say Chrysalis, not cocoon. ;-)

When I get to the pages where the catterpillar eats apples/orages/starawbaey, there is a hole in the middle of the fruits that it eats. He tries to stick his tiny finger into it and delights. At the end where the catterpillar turns into the butterfly, my son wides his hand and mimics that it turned into butterflys. He really enjoys the book very much. for bringing out to make lap-reading a special time.
