Both books are rated 4.5 but written for easily satisfied tweens. I digress...

Wouldn't recommend, it ain't splendid.
titles: When 5 star reviews are actually 2 or 3 stars

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Beautifully written and engaging story of the first year of WWII combat between England and Germany as seen through the doings of Churchill, his closest staff and advisors, and his family. Churchill himself is a complex, fierce, stirring, at times outrageous leader -- exactly what England and indeed the free world needed to face down the Third Reich as the struggle began. The other personalities in the story are also very well drawn. My only (very minor) criticism of this book is the writer's lazy overuse of the (vague, trendy) word "challenge." There are dozens of more specific and appropriate word choices.
titles: Splendid indeed  -- in drama, in revealing details, in sense of large-scale importance of the story.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Winston Churchill has been a hero to many of us, not just to those of the "Greatest Generation," but to those who still reap the rewards of their efforts. Erik Larson paints a no-holds barred portrait of this heroic and often problematic statesman, giving us behind the scenes glimpses into his family life as well as how he interacted with his office staff and chosen counselors. (He listened to opposing advice and even amended his original plans at times if others had better ideas!)
titles: Great Behind the Scenes Look at a Nation's Leader

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Splendid perspective of the war through the eyes of Winston Churchill. Engaging view of war mixed with personal confront. No.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents:
This book was wonderful. I have read a lot of Churchill, including his own books. Larson was wise to focus deeply on a narrow time - the first year of Churchill's time in office. He went into the diaries of family members, associates and gave an in depth review of where everyone's mind was during this very difficult time.

While all Larson's books are first rate, this one is unique as it covered a subject so well known and added a dimension not covered by others.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: For one who has several books on Churchill as well as Britain during the war years, "The Splendid and the Vile" exceeded my expectations. There are some facts other authors have chosen to overlook, new information brought to light, and although a bit much on daughter Mary and her diary, a perspective on how young Londoners lived and even partied through The Blitz. You will come across references to familiar authors and books you have already read like Colville, Shirer, Taylor, and of course Manchester/Reid and Martin Gilbert as well as others. The tragedies described actually gave me a greater sense of awe that the Brits themselves could endure this horror as well as they did. If you are new to Churchill or The Blitz, you will not get as much out of it as seasoned readers, but that is to be expected. In any event you will not be disappointed.
titles: Intimate perspective of people around Churchill

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents:
I am a big Churchill fan; certainly the most important leader of the 20th century. Saved Europe and the world from Hitler. I couldn't put this book down. It's a very intimate look at Churchill, his family, and close advisors during the Battle of Britain. I bought the book to add to my library of Churchill books. Buy it, read it. You won't be sorry.
It might even motivate you to travel to the UK to visit Churchill's war rooms, where he lived/was born, and is buried with his family near Oxford as I have.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Having read a good number of books about the Secon World War I was disappointed with Mr. Larson.s effort in providing us with a emmorable and informative discourse in this important event. It was a real step down from his earlier efforts such as "The Devil in the White City" There are many bettr books on this event such as Rick Atkinson's Trilogy.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I have read every book by Erik Larson, this one was not one of his best works. While the others were page turners, this one was ho-hum. I know there was new information in it but it must have been in The technical narrative as much everything else didn't seem new to me. His other two title books were balanced in the subject matter while this one was more one sided. It was just another World War II book as far as I am concerned. I was very disappointed, but I do look forward to his next book, Larson is after all a great researcher and writer. I recommend this book to anyone who like Winston Churchil, World War I'M and Battles.
titles: I have read every book by  Erik Larson, this one was not one of his best works.  While the others were page turners, this one was ho-hum.  I know there was new information in it but it must have been in The technical narrative as much everything else didn't seem new to me.  His other two title books were balanced in the subject matter while this one was  more one sided.  It was just another World War II book as far as I am concerned.  I was very disappointed, but I do look forward to his next book, Larson is after all a great researcher and writer.  I recommend this book to anyone who like Winston Churchil, World War I'M and  Battles.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: It could be challenge to write yet another book about Churchill and yet Winston is a strong enough character that it would also be almost impossible to write a bad book about him. Larson has chosen to access diaries of family and colleagues to write an engaging and informative history of a time that tried men and women. A very entertaining read and almost too current as we are at war vs the pandemic and lacking leaders of vision and clarity.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: My husband read this book, handed it to me saying "This is great, you should read it. I started that evening and stayed up al night. Could not put it down. About Chsruchill's first year as PM of England when most of the leaders wanted to come to some "agreement" with Germany to avoid going to war. Churchhill refused to even consider capitulation to Germany. This work of non-fiction is so well written, documented, and is so easy to read.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Picking up when Churchill becomes PM of England, this chronicles the days of the Blitz then until December of 1941. What Churchill and the people of Great Britain endured, and survived, is truly remarkable. This excellent, nearly day-by-day account of the struggles faced by the British allows the reader to walk the bombed out lanes and devastated landscape as did the people of England. I do recommend other works regarding the days before Churchill is elected PM. It’s astounding how misunderstood (and maligned) he was, before he became Britain’s savior.
titles: Relive the Blitz with the people of England

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I have read other books by Erik Larson and have found them riveting.This book just didn't meet the same standard, though it was engaging. I certainly got a greater appreciation for Winston Churchill and fell in love with his young daughter Mary. I recommend it.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: So far, I have yet to read a WWII historical fiction story that doesn’t put the current pandemic in perspective. This novel highlights the Battle of Britain. British citizens were defenseless against German bombers. They could hide in underground bomb shelters, but if they survived, they would emerge to see their London neighborhood or their rural towns destroyed. This becomes the background for Winston Churchill’s steadfastness and grit.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I enjoyed this book very much. At first I wondered why he would do yet another Churchill biography. His angle of approach answered my question. It is a revealing at times very intimate portray of family life during the blitz, the humdrum and the horrific. Though it focuses on the Churchill family, the reader gets a definite sense of what it was like for ordinary families to endure daily massive bombings. It is well worth the read even if - and maybe because - you think you know everything there is to know about Churchill.
titles: Interesting Account of A Very Decisive Year

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I almost gave up on this when I realized I'd made a mistake and started reading a nonfiction account of Churchill during the war. I thought I was getting a nice historical fiction novel... I can't remember why. I'm so glad I kept going because I was entertained and enlightened to equal degree. One of my favorites of the year so far!

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Very well done as are all of this author's books. A look at why Great Britain was ruthless in its response. Britain suffered greatly under the Nazi Blitz before Germany diverted itself by attacking Russia. Good read for those who know little about WWII and what happened before the United States entered the war. Winston Churchill's role in that time was much more significant than most realize today. A great man, good story.
titles: Very good, detailed documentary of a 'splendid' if unorthodox man.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: If you like detail, you will love this. It may have been too much for my book club, as I suspect many did not read or finish it. We were hoping to hear Larson speak at Literary Orange but the conference was cancelled due to COVID. We kept the book on the list. This is an account of Churchill, the man, and the people around him. It gave a glimpse of the every day life in London during the Blitz. Thankful for the generational perception, which provided some insight, with the young people still wanting to go out to dances even though bombs were falling. Makes you realize winning WW2 was not a slam dunk.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: As of Erik Larson's books, it was excellent. However, the title led me to believe that there would be a trove of information about the intimate lives of the Churchill family and those that surrounded them during the first year of Churchill's reign as Prime Minister. There was not as much "dirt" as I would have liked. Although I did learn that Eddie Duchin was Marie Harriman's lover and not her adopted son. Of the 503 pages, 450 were about bombing raids. IN any event England really took a big hurt during 1940 until US joined the war in 1942

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Such a wonderful book and interesting descriptions of a powerful yet very human and at times humorous leader (not referring to the malignant narcissist hitler). I like that the chapters are mostly short and the author flip flops between the splendid and the vile. Although I have read a lot about ww2, I am remarkably deficient in the dreadful and audacious attacks on Great Britain 🇬🇧. Don’t hesitate to read this book!

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: This is a presentation of the human actions and personalities of the main characters of WW II. Focusing on Winston Churchill and his family, it provides insights that I have not heard before. There are many parallels with the current Covid19 pandemic. No one knows how the war will end or even who will still be alive. It is clear that the author has done extensive research to document the facts that he weaves together to make an engaging story.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: History is often told as if outcomes are inevitable. There was nothing inevitable about Britain 's valiant stand; utterly alone for a year of merciless bombing. That Britain did not flag is due to the indomitable Winston Churchill, his eccentric inner circle, and the British nation. The details, sometimes quirky, are not only a fascinating read but also an inspiring example of courage to which we owe a debt of gratitude even today.
titles: A Brilliant Inside View of the Defiant Resistance that Thwarted Hitler

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents:
I have read most of Eric larson’s books & this was so perfect for now. It gave me hope & courage if the British people could be so strong during that horrific time of destruction I can too live through this pandemic. I highly recommend this book. It has history, personal insight of the people with humor & more.
Looking forward to his next book!

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I could only read the first seven percent of the book before it froze. I attempted to delete and re-purchase it but to no avail. This was an extremely frustrating and disappointing experience.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Glorious book about a dreadful War! This is a gripping read for anyone who may have lived thru this earth shaking ordeal or perhaps was not born, yet. Marvelous history of the horrors of England and the brave survival of its people, being lead by a great leader. This is a very detailed, historical record of what went on, how it happened, and where it was located. Best book I have read in sometime.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Great book! Really interesting look at a very important turning point in world history. As an American who lived in England in the 60’s, it was a real eye opener to read about places I had visited and their place in “The Blitz.” Bravo! Get this book! My only complaint is about the physical book-the pages were not glued to the cover and it fell apart before I could finish it. This was awkward and very annoying.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: As a retired history teacher, l love it when a history book reads like a novel. I learned so much reading this book and did so with joy. This is a book that I would encourage all history teachers to read and to share with their students. Churchill was a great leader and quirky also. My students always loved hearing the quirky little side stories and this book provides plenty. I would encourage any one who loves a great story to read this book.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Jim Lane, my brother, our father, Floyd Lane, served in the United Statea Amy in German during the war. Upon my fathers return after the war, he rarely spoke about his experiences. I’ve always been interested in documentaries and nonfiction books during that time. Erik Larson is definitely my favorite nonfiction author. I learned so much and enjoyed “ The Devil and the White City” and “thunderstruck “.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I have read most of Larson's books because he has such an impeccable way of making history so fascinating. This book is incredibly well-researched and intricately detailed in a way that sets it apart from other WW2 books. I walk away from reading this feeling a profound respect for Churchill's cabinet and also for the residents of London and all of England who stood firm in their pursuit of freedom.
titles: Fascinating in depth account of Churchill's first year

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents:
One of the few books that I didn't want to end. The first year of Winston
Churchill's reign as England's prime minister. Awesome, exciting and amazing.
Erik Lawson is an amazing writer..........I have read them all!

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I have read many WWII books, and many on Churchill. This stood apart for the painfully accurate details of what the British endured each night of the blitz. It also painted a fascinating view of day-to-day life in the Churchill household, giving the book a “you are there” feel which made it quite gripping. Reading it during the coronavirus quarantine & comparing it to our complaints of deprivation brought home how fortunate we are & renewed my regard for the way the English people refused to buckle.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Lengthy (nearly 600 pages) account of Winston Churchill’s first year as Prime Minister. Lots of interesting personal information as well as thorough documentation of his day to day dealings with the logistics of conducting war against an enemy that was bombing his country almost daily. The book probably could have been a couple of hundred pages shorter, but it was a worthwhile read.
titles: Typical of Larson: verbose but interesting

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Having always been a fan of Churchill and Larson, I anxiously awaited this book and the irony of reading it during the pandemic lock down was breathtaking. A brilliant reminder that we are survivors, first and always.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I gave this book 5 stars because the sheer work and dedication in putting it together clearly desrves it. The angle that the author takes to describe Churchill, family and collaborators, all moving the British forward thru the Blitz paints a vivid picture of a giant of the free world, a kind of personality that I"ve been unable to find in these much less trying times of global pandemic. I would very much recommend this book to anyone wanting to know who Churchill was.
titles: One know nothing until one know the man.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I accidentally bought the Kindle edition of this wonderful book yesterday but Amazon’s customer service is non-existent so I can’t return it. I’ve tried the toll free customer service number. It’s not operating. I’ve tried online return and it keeps sending me in a loop back to the starting point. I’m so frustrated!! I’ve never experienced such ineptitude. Fix your systems Amazon!!

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: You walk the bombed out streets with Churchill, you are a weekend guest at Chequers, you hear the animal howl of Hitler when he gets the news about Hess and his flight. Masterfully written, if you think that this just goes over the same ground as “The Darkest Hour”, you will miss an extraordinary book. Best book I have read on England facing the savagery of the third reich alone.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: The entire cast of characters played their roles well throughout a chapter of history that would challenge the best of us. These are portraits that bring the British war up close, giving insight into that time I'd not previously had. All the while I read, I kept internet access handy to delve into many of the persons, places, events. Extremely worthwhile time spent on this book.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents:
Larson is a terrific author. "Devil in the White City" and "In the Garden of the Beast...." were books he wrote that led me to buy "The Splendid and the Vile...". And it was a good choice as it presents aspects of the preliminaries to US entry into WWII that I never heard before.
His writing style is engaging and to the point. Great author and another excellent book.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I didn't think I'd learn much new about Churchill and the Blitz since the subject matter has been covered so much before, but I was wrong! Erik Larson is a freaking genius researcher who has uncovered fascinating new details and stories that he presents in his usual masterful way. Every single book he has written is a gem and The Splendid and the Vile is no exception.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Not one of my favorite Larson reads. Interesting insights into the lives of the privileged during the was years, but left more appalled than anything else.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I approached this book wondering what new could possibly be said about Churchill. I don’t believe I learned anything new, but the story, centered primarily on the Blitz, was hard to put down. Erik Larson is a wonderful narrative historian who really knows how to keep his reader engrossed. Although I have read many Churchill biographies, this one is certainly my favorite.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Well researched and artfully told, this book was a must-read for me. Larson has found stories that had not yet been told and weaves them into comprehensive story line that is engaging and sobering. You almost feel as though you can see the bombed out part of London and the battles Churchill fought to keep his country together in their most difficult battle.
titles: A Very Different View of the War from the British Perspective

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Mr Larson has done an outstanding job of documenting the first year of Winston Churchill’s Prime Ministry, May 1940 until May 1941. The day to day account is riveting. Extremely well written and thoroughly researched. It reads like a novel. A bit of a departure from his previous work but absolutely fascinating!! It is the best book I have read this year.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: History buffs, and particularly World War II aficionados, who think they knew all there was to know about Winston Churchill will delight in new discoveries as they delve into this taught and well-written account of this exceptional man as presented through the eyes of those who were closest to him. Erik Larson transports you so completely to Britain of the blitz you can almost feel and smell the devastation of those who suffered through it. "the greatest generation" can only begin to describe those courageous heroes who fought an impossible fight and won...and all due to an extraordinary man of unequaled leadership!
titles: Superb wartime biography of one of history's strongest figures.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Larson takes a most important era of world history and retells it from an original and compelling perspective. We are with Churchill, family, and inner circle throughout the Blitz — before, during, and after. We see how life continued on both for that privileged group and, through their eyes, for all in the British Isles. Highly, highly recommended.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: First of all, I adore Erik Larson’s work. This did not disappoint, I believe it’s his best next to Dead Wake. Erik Larson presents history as if it were a novel. Lots of information, the facts are presented in a way that’s far from bland. He really captures the human element of history, what people were thinking and feeling, the terror, the romance, and the tragedy. Wonderful book.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Larson, gives an interesting insight into the famous and those near the famous during the Blitz. His centering on non-central characters was a fascinating perspective into the early days of the war and the impact on the citizens of the British targets of the aerial bombing and a different view in the private lives of those around Churchill. Unlike the volumes Churchill has written about these times,this different prospective was interesting and entertaining.
titles: A fascinating different view of England and the war

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Although I thought I knew a lot about Churchill and WWII, this book taught me more. With insight from his wife, daughter and other friends, Churchill emerges as a confident leader. As the king said, no one could have lead the British through the war better than Churchill. This book is easy to read and understand. Wonderful on so many levels!

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I ordered this book and began reading, but for some reason it would not go past about page 38. Very frustrating, so I have returned it. I can not figure out how to tell you that I would like to read this book, if it would work. I have never had this problem before. Thank you - please get in touch. jgjenkins1@gmail.com
titles: Help with being able to make this book go past page 38.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: A wonderful, lively, brilliantly written account of Churchill’s first year as Prime Minister. Unlike many histories, it makes the reader wish it was just the first volume in a long series. A great read!

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: This review is about the shipping condition not the actual contents of the book. It arrived to day with what looked like fingerprint smudges all over the front cover, some disgusting looking with brown stuff stuck to it. Not sure what it was but wiped the book off immediately with Clorox wipes and sprayed with Lysol, what the heck??
titles: Smudges all over the front cover

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Winston Churchill is one of my heros. I needed something inspiring to read while on lockdown for Covid-19. This story of the beginning of England’s WWII experiences was fascinating and took my mind off the uncertain present. I enjoyed reading the diary entries of many of the characters, which gave a personal flavor to the war.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: My file of this e-book was apparently corrupted. No matter what I did, it would not allow me to advance past 6% of the book. If I tried to skip ahead or turn pages, it shut down my Kindle. Of course, there is no way to get any sort of real help from the Amazon website, or to actually talk to anyone who could help with this issue. I have deleted the book from my library in complete disgust and disappointment.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Because so much of Larson’s study of Churchill’s first year as prime minister is grounded in primary sources — and especially diaries — the reader gets a wonderfully vivid glimpse into the public and private Churchill as well as into the lives of his family members and his confederates in Britain’s wartime government.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: For fans of "Beasts" this title could be viewed as a companion piece in both time period and Larson's incredible use of first hand references. While not as sultry as some parts of "Beasts" it gives incredible perspective on Churchill and those that surrounded him. From his immediate family and others in his inner circle, to common Londoners that cheered Churchill's leadership this book lends incredible perspective to those trying to get on while the outside world seems to be going insane.
titles: Perfect book for finding optimism in chaos- Larson's meticulous research rewards his audience yet again

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I found this strangely pertinent to today - what it was like for Churchill, his family, and all of England to be under continuous stress, and how Churchill led with raw truth mixed with a dash of hope. If we only had such a leader today facing Covid-19? The book moves smoothly between the immediate family, weekends at Chequers, and the bigger picture of the war against the Nazis. Larson artfully mines the diaries of Churchill's family members and associates to create a day to day portrait of life under the capricious risk of German bombs. The adolescent hopes of Churchill's young daughter segue to the desolation of Coventry or Plymouth after a Luftwaffe attack. Life goes on amidst the ruins.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I was excited to read Erik Larson’s latest book and he did not disappoint. In recent years I have spent time in the U.K. every summer attending the International Summer School program in Cambridge where the Churchill College is located. Through a course I took I became more interested in Churchill and have sought to learn more about him and his family. Larson’s book - a snapshot of one year - provides a closeup of this great man and his family. My admiration for Churchill, his family and in particular the British people for what they endured during the Blitz has increased tremendously by reading this account of their lives during that year. I long for a leader of Churchill’s stature during this time of crisis in our world.
titles: An Intimate View of Churchill and World War II

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: This book makes you realize that our forefathers went through much greater tribulations and tests of human endurance and strength then we could. This is a story of real bravery, under fire, quite literally. It makes me ashamed of my generation and of the current one who are afraid in the face of a 99.7% survival rate. The people of England in 1940, especially in London, had much slimmer chances. Thank you Erik Larson for a very timely book.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: This is great insight to an incredible leader....his first year....his family...and the personal side of the man and his struggles. I highly recommend it.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I’ve read all of the author’s historical works. They all read like novels but are heavily researched and footnoted. This work about Churchill’s first year as PM is thoroughly entertaining and informative. Even though we all know how the story ultimately ends, we can’t help but keep turning the pages. Bravo!
titles: Another great work by the author

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Not finished yet, but a very interesting, in depth story that helps the reader have a better understanding of the mood, thinking of not only Churchhill but the public at large. I’ve read many WWII historical fiction and non-fiction writings but was never able to have this degree of in-sight. Love Eric Larson!

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents:
This is the 4th book I have read from this author. He excels in finding details that bring past people and events to vivid life.
The narrative carried me along and had me searching for more information about the people and events portrayed.
I compare the experience to times in University when a great teacher expanded my world.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: It is a joy to read a book and to realize how great it is you determine the emotional impact it has on you when you determine how sad you are as you start reaching the conclusion of the book. The greater the sadness and depession you experience the greater the book. So when you are close to a nervious breakdown the more you realize you have read a classic. You pray "please God, dont let it end."THIS WAS AS GOOD AS IT GETS. Thannk you Mr. Larson

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents:
I read a lot of books and this is probably among the best books I’ve ever read.

It tells a history of Great Britan I never knew about. Churchill was an amazing leader. Never give up attitude! This is one book I will never loan out. It will sit in a prominent place in my collection.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: This expansive view of Churchill and his retinue during the early years of the Second World War (before the United States was pulled in by the attack on Pearl Harbor) fills in an often understated aspect of the war for The American audience. The devastation of Great Britain, and the courage and leadership of Churchill make a poignant contrast to the current Coronavirus Pandemic.
titles: Churchill revealed under pressure of War

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I have read a number of books about Churchill as well as this period of history. Was concerned about learning something new but came away very pleased with my decision. Larson told the story from the personal perspective of Churchill and his family and close confidantes. Very in sight full and worth reading.
titles: A very personal story of Churchill

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Larson did and excellent job in his research to allow him to produce a book takes you into the personal thoughts and feelings of the Churchill family. It takes you into the pain and suffering of the British during this fight to their existence. I pray that we will never be faced with this challenge.
titles: A Really Great Need on Understanding Churchill

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents:
A detailed account of one year in WWII.
So detailed the reader feels they are present. A great tribute to all involved.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents:
Better than any history of the war prior to WWII one could have ever learned in college. A fantastic and intimate indiscretion. Better than being the proverbial fly on the wall.
An absolutely fascinating and exceptionally researched and written book.
Must read page turned.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: The writing by the author is second to none. You know the story and the outcome, but you are entertained by the reality of the times and events by dairies and letters of the past. The smoothness of the transition of the times and events by the nature of the authors writing to pull you in to keep reading a story that you thought was just another WWII story. You will be wrong its a story of intrigue and awe.
titles: A time travel built around word smithing into Churchills world as WWII begins---wonderfully done!!

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Erik Larsen can not be beat for historic books. This book is fabulous, just as all the other historical books I have read written by him. I do not like reading historical books because they tend to be dry, uninteresting. Larsen is my go to historian. Highly recommend!

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents:
A fabulous book that brings the reader back to these momentous days for Churchill,the people of England and the entire world.
Beautifully written and one feels as if we are right there with the PM living thru the good,bad and some horrendous days and nights.
Churchill is under appreciated today, and we all should revisit his life and value this giant..
A must read !

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: The first hand sources make for great reading and Larson does a great job of weaving them into the account. It is hard to put this down, but at least the chapters are short and make for places to stop without losing track of the events unfolding. One gets a real sense of both Churchill and the surrounding casts' personalities. A good read during the current crisis as a contrast to the style of leadership.
titles: Churchill as seen by others during his first year as PM

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: If you’re a WW2 history buff, you probably already know a lot of what’s recounted here, but Larson does his usual excellent job. Great insight into the Churchill administration and family, and into how British people resisted the Nazi onslaught. Worth reading.
titles: Solid popular history of the Battle of Britain

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents:
Great details of Churchill and his many eccentricities. Author has a way of explaining the myriad of events that makes you want to know what is next.
An amazing story told very well that makes you appreciate the struggles of the English people during the Blitz.
Really makes you realize what a great leader Churchill was when England needed a great man.
titles: Great History of the Blitz of England

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: It took me quite awhile to read this book full of detail about Winston Churchill during WWII. As other Erik Larson books I've read it was just full of facts and personal information about Churchill. How are world has changed and how did our families survive.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I have read many books devoted to the Prime Minister and his handling of the war. This work provides insights on so many individuals and in New and refreshing treatments. A very informative and a most readible volume. A must read for any history enthusiast.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: While I’ve been quarantined with the world staying away from each other with Covid-19, I thought, what better book than to read this when Britain was bombed incessantly for 8 months .How the people survived and persevered through these intense dark days reads like a gripping adventure novel. The Brits truly were a courageous, tough people ...I admired their spirit and the man, Churchill who inspired their courage...

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I always enjoy Larson’s books. An engaging writer that always finds the odd twist on otherwise fairly well known events. And with Churchill, we also have a we’ll know historical figure. So again, an enjoyable read (honestly I was a bit shocked and disappointed that I had reached the end). As much as I enjoyed this book, I nonetheless feel that this book more benefits from the subject rather than the writing. Having said that, I am going to look for another Larson book, so my critique should be weighed in that light!

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: The book was good, but I wasn't even to chapter 5 before the Kindle version kept crashing/closing. There were blank pages and the book would then crash yet again. I tried reloading the version to the device -- no luck. Since the Kindle version is more expensive than the hard cover, I expect to actually be able to READ it.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: The excerpts from the diaries of those closest to Churchill as well as those from private citizens, during this period of detestable onslaught by the German regime lend an enlightening aspect of the love and loyalty as well as the courage of the wonderful people of Great Britain.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: My book is stuck on 7%. I ordered a new one but it only comes on kindle cloud, not my kindle. Help!
titles: How to get the book on the kindle

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Churchill is obviously well researched as great men tend to be. But Larsen’s focus on the first year of the war brings fresh insight. I find helpful parallels to our struggles to deal with the pandemic in the spring of 2020. It is am engaging story.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents:
such a disappointment....a trivial account of Churchill and War World II. I expected much more for Mr. Larson than a book about Churchill's naps, eating habits, sleeping arrangements and his daughter and her friends dating habits.

If you like trivia I.e. such as where the King and Queen got their soft toilet paper from during the War --- this book is for you!
titles: Such a disappointment from such a great writer

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: A quick and stimulating glimpse into the extraordinary character of Winston Churchill. For me, it whets my appetite for a more detailed presentation of the challenges he faced of which there are so many. Light and airy. Maybe enough for you.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: As usual, I enjoyed Erik Larson’s writing immensely. However, in this case I feel that the book was just too long. It could have been edited down about 100 pages without losing any of the interest. By the end, I just wanted to finish the book already. Overall, I liked the book and would recommend it to history buffs. Certainly gives many good anecdotes and as with other of his books, helps bring history to life.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Maintaining perspective is difficult at this time. This masterful work gives us a gripping reminder of a time when a nation faced the almost certain death of their freedom, the actual death of friends and family, and all the horrors that come when war comes to your street. We should take a lesson from that time of tribulation and strive to face our current situation with similar grit and determination. This book is not just informative, it is inspirational.
titles: Great book to read during the virus

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Any fan of history will enjoy the details of this well documented account of trial and tribulations. Amazing how politics across the globe can influence the outcome of events. As the planet becomes small we can well appreciate what went before us, and how we handle the challenges that arise.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: We've been hit with a lot of documentaries and movies about Churchill and the first year of WWII. This book goes deeper and wider, has more detail, and explodes a few common myths. As always with Larsen, it is well-written and researched.
titles: Just when you think you know everything about that first year...

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: A Fantastic recount of the indefatigable resolve and spirit of a great leader and his people.It is ironic be reading about this courage as we are surrounded by people afraid to leave their houses without a facemask during the pandemic.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: One of the best books I have read in a long time. Non-fiction and incredibly detailed research but reads like a novel. I unequivocally recommend this book, whether you think you know it all about WWII history, or know nothing and are unsure if it will interest you.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents:
What a talented author to share unique perspective on 1940.
I can’t put it down and must finish before gifting it to a Churchill fanboy.
Then, I have to start thru Larson’s other books...what a terrific project that will be.
titles: Outstanding look at Churchill during this pivotal year.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Larson has done it again! Well-written and researched account of Churchill 's first year as PM and war-torn London during the Nazi blitz. Very personal and intimate reveal of familial relationships and those he entrusted to defend and guide Great Britain through its darkest days of the war. Recommended.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Good not great, certainly not compared to Doris Kearns Goodwin. Did I enjoy it? Yes, indeed.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I am not an avid reader, but any new Erik Larson book is a must for me. This one did not disappoint. Amazing what the Brits went through during the blitz and how Churchill was the right person at the right time. Highly recommend.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: A fascinating portrait of Churchill's first year as prime minister as well as England's first year of war. Going back and forth between Churchill's problems fighting the Germans and dealing with the blitz and the citizens of London and how they coped gives me a better understanding of the way lives were turned upside down.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: My new favorite author since Pat Conroy passed away - haven't been disappointed yet. Churchill biography during war years is riveting. Parallels to leadership required during COVID-19 crisis are interesting. This is a must read.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Engaging and informative story of Churchill and some others close to him that helps the reader get a more intimate sense of what it was like to be at the center of the near magical leadership that was Churchill. Hard to put down.
titles: Engaging and informative story of Churchill

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: The choice of concentrating on a single critical year and enriching the history with a variety of characters surrounding Churchill who were important to him personally or to the story of that year in the war was I think a wise one. After reading the book, I felt that the inclusion of small personal details and the perspectives and experiences of other characters made the experience vivid and relatable. The shorter time frame helped bring the history to life and allowed this rather different, and definitely readable, strategy to work.
titles: Wonderful read with a different perspective.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I love this author and I am fascinated by Churchill, so I could hardly wait to read this. This book includes a great deal of detail, but, for me, it was absolutely fascinating. I learned a lot. If you liked the movies Darkest Hour and Dunkirk, you will find this deeply interesting and entertaining.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I have read everything that Mr. Larson has published and enjoyed every one. This book explored Churchill differently than other books have done. More back story of his trials during WWII and the people around him. Very interesting.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: A keen ,readable historical and cultural story of what it was like to live during the Blitz, this reader appreciates rhe effort it took for the author to research the family life of the Churchill’s and those close to them.delightful read.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I didn’t find this book as good as some of Larson’s previous work including In the Garden of Beasts which uses a similar platform but is much better. It’s worth a read but I don’t think it will knock anyone’s socks off.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Excellent history we should all read especially now when we think we are suffering due to Covid19 restrictions (hunt we are going through nothing compared to this). Lots of fun bunny trails that are chased down as well.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: As always the author uses a backdrop of a historically well known time/events to tell a personal story. Or is it a backdrop of personal stories to frame a well known historical time? Hard to tell. I loved both angles
titles: Great insight into a beloved character

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Decline and Fall of the Third Reich and Alone were better. Expected more from previous works by the author Eric Larson.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: So much has been written about Churchill and World War 2 that I was expecting another history book. This reads like a novel and is very entertaining. The characters are remarkaby real and the read was very much fun!

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Mr Lasso, the author, wrote an interesting book of behind the scenes characters to include Churchill, and their personalities. It is mostly about Churchil's charismatic leadership before America's involvement in WWII

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: This interesting and informative read was a splendid chronicle of Great Britain’s early part played in WWII. Very detailed writing of the issues that faced Winston Churchill and his advisors, family and United States as an undeclared Ally.
titles: Informative chronicle of the early years of Winston Churchill in WWII.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: What a book of love and hate, strong and weak, beautiful and ugly. Larson covers it all. Churchill was so unique and contrary that nobody could guess his next move. He was the man for the time. Great read!!!

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Fascinante relato sobre Churchill durante el primer año de la Segunda Guerra como Primer Ministro, sus relaciones con diferentes personajes, y el horror de lo que fue el bombardeo sobre Gran Bretaña. Por fin se aclara que Churchill no estaba enterado ni fue “complice” del bombardeo sobre Coventry.,

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: All of Erik Larson’s books are excellent. Readable and fast moving. This one was fascinating with side stories to bolster the central theme of Britain’s fight for survival until the U. S. came to their rescue.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I'm both a Churchill buff and an Erik Larson fan, so perhaps my expectations were TOO high. However, if you are interested in Winston Leonard Spencer Churchill, this is a good light read about his time as PM.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I’ve been reading Erik Larson since I first came across Issac’s Storm almost 20 years ago on a business trip to Chicago. Each new book is an event for me, and this one, featuring my favorite historical figure, Winston Churchill, is a full fledged parade. Combining the horrors of the Blitz with intimate details of Churchill’s life as both prime minister and father, reveals far more about that tumultuous time than any normal biography could. Now the hard part comes ... waiting another few years for Larson’s next book. History takes time.
titles: Another wonderful book by Erik Larson

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Another extraordinary book by Erik Larsen, it puts the reader right beside Churchill during that fateful year of World War II. Larsen brings history to life, making me wish he could write a book every year.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Through Larson’s details and overall review of life in London and at 10 Downing Street during the blitz you smell the cordite, suffer the dread of doom, and feel the elation of victory. A wonderful book.
titles: Puts you in Churchill’s inner circle

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I love Erik Larson books--have read them all. I am a WW II history novice and thought that t would be dry and boring--even though it was by Larson. I was wrong. I couldn't put it down and read it in three days. The world was/is lucky to have Churchill and Erik Larson to bring him to life.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I’ve read all his books except the one about the gun. He’s the best at digging into history and finding new connections and twists in often well documented events. Who would have thought that there was any thing else interesting to discover about Churchill.
titles: Fans of WWII won’t be disappointed

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Enjoyed reading. The pressure and fear that were experienced by the citizens of England must have been immense. I feel the world is experiencing the same concerns as we navigate the coronavirus at this time.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Any work written by Mr. Larson is Splendid and The Splendid and the Vile is no exception. His usual attention to detail, character development, flow of the story, is all here. Thank you, Mr. Larson.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: This is the best book that I have read in 2020. This is a book that I highly recommend. Larson always delivers. He is an outstanding writer. A remarkable read. Do yourself a favor and read this book.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: This is not Larson's best book. It is slow and difficult to plow through. Interesting facts in it. Not his usual style of writing and not good enough to hold my interest. It was a task to finish it.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I learned a great deal as I walked with the author and Winston. WWII changed everything and ruined everything. If it wasn't for Churchill, Hitler, Stalin and Mousallini would have divided the earth.
titles: Winston Churchill was born to save England from Hitler

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Another good historical book by Larson and should be of interest to those who are intrigued by World War two. I was distracted due to fact that parts of book were missing. I knew the outcome.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Accidently purchased. Stop having ads with children buying random ads. This is a waste of 20 stupid words on review.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I have read all of Larson’s books and always enjoy them. This is a great story of Churchill’s first year in office. If you think your job is tough......read this book! Larson did it again.
titles: If you think your job is tough.....read this book.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I bought this for my mom and had it shipped directly to her, so I haven't read the book myself, but she is still raving about how much she enjoyed it. Perhaps you, too, could make your mother happy with this purchase.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I have been a fan of Erik Larson for years. His research is impeccable and reminds me of other favorite authors such as Wouk and Michener.I do hope there will be another book coming.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I so enjoyed this book because I like history and found that the characters were so incredible to survive and keeping the faith that it would get better...I learned so much and have such respect for the survivors.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: With all of the biographies written on Sir Winston Churchill, who would think there could be a new one worth reading? Erik Larson took this one over the top in his prose, which is as if you are right there; and how the correspondence he has researched is integrated into a fascinating story. Yes, this book is worth the read and I could barely put it down.
titles: Yes, there is room for another biography!

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Excellent, nicely constructed history of England during the Blitz, with German and American perspectives counterbalancing that of Churchill and country. Accessible and interesting.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I have read and enjoyed all of Mr. Larson's books, but I found this book to be his best. He is an absolute genius and wonderful wordsmith. Bravo and thank you for this interesting story.
titles: As good as good can get

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I have always been fascinated by the character of UK Prime minister during world war since I was a child as my father kept quoting Winston Churchill. Naturally, I wanted to know more about him. Erik Larson eloquently gets into describing the whole scene. Despite having no pictures ;-) I love the book.
titles: A book that you want to going back to

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: The books reads as if the reader is watching one year of Churchill 's life unfold while allowing us to hear from those most close to him. On some occasions we simply watch, on others we hear from and speak to his personal secretary, his daughter, his wife, confidants, etc. Very insightful look at WSC
titles: Looking through a window into one very critical year of Churchill's life

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Another fantastic book by Erik Larson. I don’t know where to begin except to say get this book if you like to read about World War II. Well written, well researched as always.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Disappointed in product quality. Audio disks misnumbered. Makes it difficult to follow. Too bad since the narrative itself is wonderful. Erik Larsen may want to switch publishers.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I am .25% of the way through. Despite being in covid lockdown and having plenty of time to read I probably won’t finish it. Very disappointed. This book draws heavily on John Colville’s memoirs which I read in the 80s. Unoriginal and uninspiring. Buy Andrew Roberts’ biography instead.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: A gripping account of Churchill's first year as prime minister. It's all here . The action, the drama of the rescue at Dunkirk , then England standing alone against the Nazis, the Blitz.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: What a wonderful view of the inner workings of the English government during WWII! I shall be forever thankful for everything they did to remove the awful Nazi government!

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents:
A page turner ..
From day one of the war with Germany a blow by blow description of the resolve and anguish during those first days of the war.
Another wonderful read.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Reads like a novel. Facts are well known for the most part but additional details make the period of the London blitz considerably more vivid and Churchill more laudable: right man in the right place at the right time.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: This book captures the feel of being around Churchill in his key first year as prime minister. You can feel the suffering and the determination of the British through their finest hour.
titles: New View of a Great Character

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I had not followed Churchill in school back in the 60's, unbelievable how little I knew about this important, outstanding person. Excellent for someone not very familiar with that history period!

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: This book was incredible. Fast paced. Insightful. Many different perspectives of the war effort during churchills first year. All the diary inputs added invaluable detail. I couldnt put this book down. The description of the devastating reality that the bombings had on the city, and the atmosphere of the city during the nighttime raids, interlaced with intricate details, were amazing. I had a strong feeling this book would be amazing given the extraordinary circumstances.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: A well written enjoyable book. Erik Larson has done it again with an interesting account of a fascinating subject. I only regret I can not give the review more stars.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: This is a remarkable story of Churchill’s leadership during the Blitz as well as an intimate account of his relationship with his family and his cabinet members.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I am a fan of Eric Larsen literature so I expected this book to be good and I was not disappointed. The in depth look into the private lives of the Churchill family was engrossing.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: This book is well written, and not at all dry or boring like a lot of history related books. If you are a fan of Churchill, then you will really like this book.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Larson offers many personal details about this pivotal year in European history. However, these interesting descriptions of courage and character are seriously marred by the narrator of the audiobook version. His overly dramatic, staccato voice is abrasive and distracting. Furthermore his enunciation of Churchill's words garbles many of them. The compelling history does not need this level of melodrama.
titles: Audiobook version has disappointing & distracting narrator

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Beautifully researched and written. Spellbinding. Sat up till after midnight reading it. One of the best books I have ever read about courage and perseverance.
titles: amazing book about Churchill and the Brits in WW2

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: The font style is hard on the eyes. This is really unfortunate since it's very well written and I had very much been looking forward to finishing the story.
titles: Font style hard on the eyes

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: This book was very well written. I liked how the story was told through different individual perspectives. The use of personal diaries as source info was very effective in revealing Churchill's character. I have read several books by Larson. This was no disappointment.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents:
Wow- what a read. Churchill gritty and defiant during Britain’s suffering during the early years of WW2. What gave him such confidence that the Brits could survive, yet even ultimately triumph. Wonderfully detailed first year (May 1940 to May 1941): his speeches, British endurance and suffering, the wooing of FDR.
Thank you Eric Larson for doing a mountain of research and weaving it so skillfully and interestingly together.
titles: Winston Churchill’s amazing leadership vs. Nazis

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Erik Larson is clearly one of my favorite authors. He has mastered the technique of relaying history in both a factually authentic and entertaining manner. My only regret at getting to the end was the long wait until his next work.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Read many Books on Churchill,, I enjoyed reading so much of the family,, very interesting,, this book is brings out the very human side of this great man.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I’ve read several books ABOUT and BY Churchill. This is a refreshed look at just one year, the first year, and explores the man and his family and his surrogate family (his secretaries, aides, and ministers) anew. The bombings are the thread used to weave this new story. I appreciated the unique lens to view this familiar subject.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: This book shares some new information about Churchill. The author is an amazing story teller, and uses some unique sources. MUST BUY. I think I have sold 15 copies to friends alone. Damn good book.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents:
On the 75th anniversary of VE day, I give this book the highest rating possible. I've read everything I could regarding
the Battle of Britain, and this is, by far, in my mind, the best. The authors insights into the personalities involved is fascinating.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: The book was fabulous, but the transmission to my kindle was not. Three times i had to skip over parts because they would not come up on my screen. The only way to continue the book was to move the curser to the right and go past the "stuck" parts. Very disappointing.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Outstanding. Takes you inside Number 10 and elsewhere with Churchill. A perfect primary source without all the fluff and window dressing. Great read.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents:
I bought this book on Kindle and was really into it, but the page wouldn't turn after I was 7% in. So I returned it and ordered a new one and now I can't even open it, I missed the return date.
Erik Larson is a wonderful author! I want to finish the book!

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: This book is a fantastic look inside the personal story of PM Winston Churchill during the dark days of World War II. Each chapter is like a tasty morsel of a delicious meal - so well written, captivating and satisfying. I’m sad to finish the book - it’s been such a great distraction during this current great world wide disaster.
titles: This book is a delicious meal the personal life of Churchill during WW2.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Filled with wonderful historical vignettes and terrifying war history - a wonderful, fascinating and very readable chapter of Churchill’s incredible leadership.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: What would the world be like if FDR lost his last election? If America had not entered WW2? This is a real page turner on the war agony that England and most specifically London endured and the unbelievable confidence that Churchill inspired in the English people. As he said “I didn’t inspire the courage of the English people, I simply focused the courage they all had.” So many daily details that build a sense of the rhythm of life and its changes.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I normally really enjoy this author and I don’t think he was the issue here. Just a story that has been told many, many times and I don’t think he added anything new to it. Just ok for me.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Another riveting historical account by Erik Larson. The family life of the Churchill’s in the face of the bombardment of England is inspiring (and more than a bit nuts). The German perspective through Goebbels makes for an interesting contrast.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: During these "challenging" times it's nice to take a few hours and forget about what's going on. This book will teach you a bit about leadership.
titles: Always a Great Read by a Great Author

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I loved the prose , bought 12 copies and sent to friends today. Captured the horror of the blitz and the life of great people during this period

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: The vocabulary alone is worth the read. I could not cease my reading so I ignored the rest of my world and blissfully enjoyed this narration of the amazing man, Winston Churchill. Thank you for writing this book!

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Fascinating story about Churchill and how England coped before America entered the war. Too bad the download was so bad I had to figure out how to read the book and deal with the book constantly returning to the home page. And Amazon was no help with this, since there is no one to contact or talk to. And suggesting via 'chat' that I redownload the book produced the same poor quality download. Don't buy this book for your Kindle - get the hard copy and enjoy.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: The best book on behind the scenes in London during ww2. I could ramble on but if you’re in to ww2 history London Germany Churchill,you want be disappointed.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Erik Larson never disappoints. His research and vivid accounts are always informative and paint a picture of realism with detail and new insights into times past.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I've been recommending this book to all of my friends. It was a real page-turner and I was disappointed when I reached the last page.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Different perspectives and personal backgrounds of the characters in this period of history. Can't wait for the next book! Have read every book by larson and he never disappoints.
titles: Great read with typical Larson research

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Well researched and entertainedly presented. Made the great man more human. I highly recommend this book to anyone interested in this era.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Larson’s weakest book. I’ve read them all and this one disappoints. Too much extraneous detail, very little real insights into the Battle of Britain. Reads more like a celebrity gossip column than an insightful history or biography.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Another great contribution by author Larson. He has that unique ability to make history come alive again and, most important, to make it relevant.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I found this book to be not as engrossing as some of Erik Larsen's other works, yet still interesting and of co I learned a lot

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I learned a lot about that period in time and it was done so sequentially that it was easy to understand. Churchill was a complicated, brave man and was needed for that time.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Excellent read - just what you would expect from Erik Larson. Filled with history and events behind that compelling history.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Great story to read during these times of the flu crisis. The pressure the people of the UK put up with is very encouraging.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
