review_contents: The life of Winston Churchill, in any phase is filled with interest grabbing stories. This book covers the first year of Churchill's service as PM and covers the Battle of Brittan in good detail. For history buffs it is a must read
titles: Just When You Think There Can't Be Another Churchill Book - There is And It Is Great

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: This is such a well written book, and I found it so inspiring, especially during this COVID-19 time of "staying at home." The "hardships" that I have had to face are nothing compared to the daily BOMBINGS that the citizens of the UK experienced DAY AFTER DAY during WWII. No exactly analogous of course! PM Winston Churchill was such an incredible orator and leader! If you like historical fiction, I would highly recommend the book!

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Am enjoying the book but the copy downloaded to my Kindle seems to have problems. Has locked up the Kindle a couple of time.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: A real page turner, I couldn't put the book down. Very highly recommended for any fan of Churchill and the Second World War.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: One of the better books about The Battle of Britain. Learned that the bombings were much worse than history books depicted, and could feel the love England had for their great leader. Too much of the romantic lives of Mary, Pamela and John, but, boy, wasn't Randall an ass!

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Well written. Book shipping and packaging was very good. Arrived on time. Great read, especially in these difficulty times.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: What an incredible read! As always, Larson does not disappoint. Definitely the best book I've read this year. Highly recommend!!!

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Fascinating portrait of Churchill,his family and advisors. This is an extremely well documented and readable book. I highly recommend it.
titles: Fascinating portrait of Churchill ,his family, and his advisors.  Thoroughly enjoyable and enlightening.  I whole heartedly  recommend this book to everyone.  The documentation is remarkable.  Even the bibliography was interesting.  Erik Larson has outdone himself.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I found the book interesting and well written. The tenuous period of time during WW2 for Britain with Churchill as PM.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: The book humanized Churchill the man, with all his quirks. Full of interesting details, the book moves along quickly, providing new insights into the war Germany brought to England and the fortitude of her people during that awful time.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Can’t put it Down! Most unusual for nonfiction but not for an Eric Larsen book. Most detailed, insightful and riviting!

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Well written, insightful, and fast moving. It showed a side of Churchill that is little known as well as giving a feel for the Blitz. The courage of the British is still inspiring.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I enjoy history and biographies about great men like Churchill. This was a great book, I read it in a couple days.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: The factual material was fine but too much of the personal lives of many characters. I was at 20 pct to go and the story ended and went into historical summary that was common knowledge. I would have liked more from the german point of view and strategy.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: This book is about Winston Churchill and World War II. It is quite interesting an dwell worth the time to enjoy.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Another great Eric Larson book. One of his best. A historical account that is a page turnrr. Hard to put down. I
titles: Erice Larson fans will love this great account of Churchill saving England

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: The story is fine but the book literally fell apart. I haven’t even gotten halfway through it and the front of the book is falling out a chunk of pages at a time. I paid far too much money for a hardcover that should last a lifetime for it to fall apart before I finish it.
titles: The story is OK...the Book is not

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Many new stories and presentations vs. usual histories. A refreshing look at Churchill and the times. My favorite review of the early war years.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: A phrase appropriate not only for its subjects but for the book itself. You will not forget this vital time.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: He is a great author who keeps you captivated from beginning until end. I highly recommend all of his books!

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: This is the rare work of history that reads like a novel and still sheds new light on the subject. Read it!
titles: A Fresh and Engaging Look at Churchill's Innermost Circle During the Blitz Years

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Non-fiction is usually not my genre. After receiving a glowing review from my son, I thought I’d give it a chance. This book is filled with intrigue, joy, sadness, terror, and every other emotion. By focusing on just Churchill’s first year, the reader gets such clear insight into who the man really was and what made him tick.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: well written history of England during the war. Learned so much about the politics and personalities of the time.
titles: another great book by Erik Larson

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I’ve read most of the authors books and this one was my favorite. Sad it ended. The end came on rather quickly and felt somewhat rushed.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I didn't learn too much more than I already knew about the war and the blitz, and maybe even Churchill himself. But it was a truly fascinating portrait of a great leader and the people who moved around him all the same. Very enjoyable, exhaustively researched, and all around really very good.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Twenty or more words are required loren ipsum res ipsa loquitur nine more words are required to finish this ok.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Like being there. Absolutely authentic -- nothing made up. Excruciating. How they persevered is incredible. This is history that should be known.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: If you like Churchill, you will love this book. Also tells a lot about the amazing partying, socializing, drinking, and gourmet dining that was constantly going on as England was being brutally bombed.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Written beautifully. It offers a meaningful and thoughtful insight into world war 11. Larson combined enormous knowledge about Churchill,his surroundings, and with deft precision captures the nightmare of war. His characters come alive. Definitely 5 stars.
titles: Outstanding dose of reality in Churchill 's world

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I would read anything by Erik Larson. His books are among my favorites. This does not disappoint!

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: My husband and I enjoyed reading this book. Good read and historically well done. Entertaining and kept my interest.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Good read as always with Larson. He writes nonfiction that reads like fiction. Thoroughly enjoyed the read. Will try more of his.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I love Erik Larson's books, they're always so we'll researched and read like novels. This was no exception, I loved it!

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I'm happy to have the book...BUT I did not ask for nor did I want a LARGE PRINT edition. I should have been informed if that was what I was going to be mailed

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: This book froze and booted me out repeatedly around Chapter 4 (8%). Tried to re-download, reboot device, etc. etc. several times. Then sold back the book for a refund and re-ordered. Same problem. Please fix this and send an update!

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: can Mr Larson is very good 👍in his attention to the individual emotions and to me makes it all worthwhile
titles: As usual I enjoyed Mr. Larson 's work.  Please do not take the following comments to be over critical.  There are at two items I would like to call to his attention..  1.  The code machine called Ultra was in English hands after the invasion of Poland.  2.  Churchill knew about the attack on Coventry.  My information comes from Anthony C. Brown's work BODYGUARD Of LIES  Maybe I should tell soom details about me.  I have a MASTERS IN HISTORY AND HAVE BEEN A TEACHER FOR 20 YEARS..  PLEASE DON'T TAKE THIS AS A BAD STATEMENT OF THIS WORK.  I WILL HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS OOK TO MY FRIENDS

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Tight focus on the first year of Churchill as Prime Minister leaves time to focus on the personal side. Who ever thought about the financial challenges of Churchill and his family? Also, love and love affairs in time of war. Great read.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I am an avid reader of WW2 literature, and I truly enjoyed this book. Many do not understand what England went through during the Blitz, and the author does this quite well. The personal anecdotes and accounts truly make this book one of a kind in WW2 literature.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: For a history bluff the juxtaposition between the haves and the have nots is dramatically spelled out by life in the subways and the drinking and dancing till dawn.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Extremely well written treatment of Churchill and his inner circle during 1940 and 1941.
titles: Wonderful book on Churchill in the early war years.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Larsen is a fabulous teller of tales. This intimate history of a period of history ,through which i lived ,brought winston churchill and his family to life in a very real way.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: A magnificent work. I've read all but one of the authors books. This one was a treasure.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: This was a great read. Especially with the trials and tribulations that we are going through at the current time. I couldn't imagine having to withstand the incessant bombings on an almost daily basis. Churchill was a true leader who came along at the perfect time to.lead his people. This is worth a read if you are a history buff.
titles: Amazing story of resilience and triumph.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: For anyone interested in history during WWII this is an excellent summary of how Britain survived in 1940 & 1941. Amazing record.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Great book. It has launched me into reading everything I can get my hands on about WWII.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Learned a great deal about Churchill and the London bombings. Another wonderful Erik Larson historical fiction.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Great in depth research, beautiful writing and captured the Spirit of the British.
titles: Churchill and WWII done better than ever

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: wonderfully written, kept interest high throughout. Recommended to many friends.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: You can’t beat Erik Larson when it comes to researching and telling a good story

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Have read all of the author's books - and while not my favorite - it portrayed the full impact of the Blitz

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents:
At times too much military detail but it was a more nuanced look at Churchill & the politics of the time than others looking at the man.
I particularly liked the inclusion of mass observers' viewers, the nightlife & domestic minutiae

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: He enlivens history like no other with clear, infectious writing. I always feel I am in the room looking on.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: enjoyed IT VERY MUCH AND LEARNED A LOT OF NEW THINGS ABOUT CHURCHILL AND WWII

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Loved this book and have already passed it on to others. Couldn't put it down

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Even if history is not your thing--this book will be your thing. Great read.
titles: I am recommending this book to everyone

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents:
Extraordinarily well written, unique and interesting angles on Churchill, his family members, London, English society and the German High Command during the first year of WW 2. This is my fourth Larson book, and never have been disappointed
.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: One of the best Churchill books I’ve read. You get a real inside feeling for those closest to Churchill. I believe Churchill was the greatest man of the 20th century. I read this book during the U.S. rioting of May and June 2020, and was struck by how hard England’s citizens struggled to preserve their country while we were destroying ours from within.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Not up to the quality of Larson's other books; it was rather slow going in places, but I made it to the end. I was a bit annoyed by the poor quality of the book's construction. The bottom of the spine had a sharp edge that would jab my hand and distract me from my reading - that shouldn't happen. Not enough to return the book since I did finish it.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Thorough research and gripping details of Churchill's leadership of Great Britain during WWII with intimate stories of love, friendship and Churchill's quirky but endearing habits. This book inspires courage during our own troubled times and a longing prayer for leaders to guide us with unrelenting determination, passion and moral decency to achieve the common good.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Reminds us of what our parents endured during WWII and the Blitz in England. Inspirational for today's challenges.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: A total picture of Churchhill during World War II and the people that surround him. Interesting read.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents:
Great insight into the inner thoughts and workings of Churchill as he navigates Britain through the Battle of Britain much from diaries of the key figures including , interesting enough Goebbels.

The author’s ability to take all this information without losing site of great narrative is noteworthy.
titles: Brilliant story of a Brilliant man! He was the man who saved the world

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Excellent book. Very engrossing and informative, a page-turner.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Well written and very well researched. Takes the reader behind the scenes of the Churchill family during WWII. A great read.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I could not finish this. I did not find it interesting at all.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents:
Every bit as good as The New York Times said it was, “fresh, fast and deeply moving.” That and more. Much more.

Highly recommend this book and anything Erik Larson writes.

He’s good. Dam(n) good.
titles: Erik Larson and Churchill:  a Dynamic Duo

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: A compelling read. Made me feel the pain and strain of what Churchill, his immediate circle and the British people endured during 1940 and 41.
titles: Insight into Churchill and his circle

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Provided excellent details about a myriad of individuals without muddling up their identities or the story. This book captures the heart and soul and determination of England during her darkest and most brilliant time.
titles: Unique and captivating insight to Churchill’s life and leadership

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I hate history! So why do I love this book? What a story.
titles: History Class should read like this...

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: This is a great book. Larson's style of writing is something that I have long enjoyed. This story is particularly well suited for his style. I have bee luck enough to have visited London several times and am familiar with he War Rooms, etc. Really brings ties everything together!

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Although I know the subject well, this book is exciting to read!

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I’ve grown to appreciate the narrative non fiction style above all else. Larson is the master. He puts us right there - inside history, with meticulous detail that adds insight but never superfluous. As with his other works, I’m enriched with a new depth of understanding to a pivotal chapter on the world stage.
titles: Narrative non fiction that reads like a gripping novel

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Larson is a writer with the gift of clarity. One is drawn into the story immediately. At the end, I felt I knew Winston,Mary and many other characters.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents:
Informative, educational, and written in a way that kept me
engrossed until the last page. Mr. Larson, thank you for another
wonderful book.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Just arrived and dived right in. So far, so good. If you like history, this is a prime example of what one should read. No punches pulled. Good or evil, history is history. It happened and there are always lessons to be learned. Churchill was a complex man and I've read other accounts of him. Larsen will not disappoint.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents:
Author (as always) is great.
Just 2 months after purchasing, this Crown publication has completely fallen apart as I read it. Poorly bound hardcopy is cheap and not worth the price. Every few pages snap out of the binding. Worthless. Hardcopy publication is zero stars. Amazon will not replace due to time elapsed.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Gripping as typical of an Eric Larson book. I love his style of weaving a visual story using the historical documents. I always end feeling that I have lived the story.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Wonderful book my husband enjoyed every page!

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Sorry I didnt keep better track of characters and their positions begnning of reading. Would have saved me back reading. Still really liked this book. Larson writes with balance of facts and personal stories of characters.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: A truly miraculous account of the first year Of Churchill’s charge of saving England during WW2. Focused in his first year as Prime Minister - his effort to get America to join the British to fight the Nazi’s.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Great uplifting read. How real leaders lead.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents:
Larson is a wonderful story teller. And in addition to the story, he introduces the players in a very intimate and personal way.
The reader becomes personally involved.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Purchased for husband, Father's Day Gift.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Thoroughly enjoyed knowing the central characters, especially family and close aides. Churchill was such a dominating personality, throughout his life, that one doesn’t realize the value of those around him.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Once again Erik Larsen has written an historical piece that reads like a novel. I believe all readers whether history buffs or just book buffs would enjoy this book tremendously. I think I especially enjoyed the looks into the German command. This is one of those books that you don't want to get to the end.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents:
Like others have found, the Kindle version froze 7% in and I am unable to read the rest. It looks like this problem has been out there for 2 months - quite disappointing for it not to have been fixed, or for the Kindle version to be pulled until it does.

I did enjoy the first 6%. Too bad I'll never read the rest.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Can't wait to read... perfect delivery

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents:
Another wonderful sampling of history by Eric Larson. Larson shows why Churchill was such an effective and empathetic leader during WWII, especially during the Blitz of London and the British by the Nazis.

A wonderfully illustrative book that contrasts sadly with the lack of leadership in the White House today.
titles: Effective, empathetic leadership: something sadly lacking in the US today

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Excellent read At an excellent price

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Really enjoyed the humanity portrayed along side the immense gravity of daily life during a war. Very wonderfully written !

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: He takes the confusion out of the battle of Britain and your understanding of WW2. I never realized the extent of damage Germany caused Great Britain reading this made me forget about the Corona virus
titles: Larsons book is his best yet

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: A very well written book about Churchill and his time as Prime Minister during WW II. Truly a great leader at a perilous time.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Larson his master class at writing non-fiction in a way that reads so easily. I am in awe on how each human story he chooses to focus on weaves into the overarching history of the time he is writing about. Putting a solid lens on Mary and Pamela Churchill was particularly interesting!

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: I love this writer and this book does not disappoint. Strongly recommend, especially if you’re looking for a new angle on wwii

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Erik Larson is a great author. This book, as well as his others, are terrific reads. He brings an interesting insight and perspective to his subjects. Fascinating and educational read.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: It kept me interested from beginning to end. I really enjoy this more personal side of Churchill, his family dynamics and the people he led during the war. Very interesting book!
titles: Excellent Book by one of my favorite authors

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: As always, historically accurate, just the right amount of personal drama and clearly shows what leadership in the face of overwhelming challenges resembles.
titles: The aerial bombing of England puts two months of ‘stay @ home’ in perspective.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: Incredible book. Brings history alive in a captivating way - one of my favorites of all time

review_contents: For me the most interesting aspect of the book was how the Germans miscalculated England's resolve, and the poor strategic decisions that followed. I've read a few Churchill biographies and didn't discover anything new about him in this book, nor was I expecting to find any. It's a good read.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents: This is a tremendously written book. Heavy on historical facts, yes,but even more so on alleged “trivial” aspects of each character’s lives that make it so appealing!

review_contents: This is another great work by Erik Larson. Gave me a new perspective on Churchill. I found some of the characters’ side stories a bit unnecessary, but overall this was a great read. Page turning interest throughout.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents:
Erik Larson's "The Splendid and the Vile" focuses on the period between May 1940 and May 1941. After Neville Chamberlain failed in his attempt to make peace with Hitler, sixty-five-year-old Winston Churchill became England's prime minister. Churchill surrounded himself with trusted advisors and employed his impressive oratorical skills to keep his countrymen from losing heart. Initially, in spite of Churchill's pleas, President Franklin Roosevelt refused to offer much-needed military and economic aid to Great Britain. Roosevelt knew all too well how reluctant most Americans were to become involved in another bloody conflict.

The author conveys the chaos of this turbulent year, provides glimpses into the personal lives of those in Churchill's orbit, and offers insight into the strategy of the German high command. Larson is a meticulous researcher whose primary sources include diaries, letters, and memoirs. We learn the extent to which Clementine Churchill, Winston's wife, staunchly supported her husband. She was politically astute, tough under pressure, and compassionate towards her fellow citizens. Unfortunately, Churchill's long hours, irascibility, and mood swings took a significant toll on his family. Randolph, the Churchills' rebellious son, grew up to become an alcoholic, compulsive gambler, and a ladies' man (even after he was married and had a child of his own).

"The Splendid and the Vile" reinforces what many of us already know about Churchill's eccentricities, bursts of energy, and bouts of depression. Humorous and lively anecdotes enliven the narrative but, as it progresses, it becomes repetitious, and could have been pared down with no loss of impact. There is too much information about the parties attended by Churchill's youngest daughter, Mary; the weekends that the Churchills spent eating lavish meals and entertaining guests; the romantic longings and liaisons of various characters; and the infighting between self-important government officials.

However, it is impossible to be unmoved by the commitment, spirit, and dedication of Churchill, the airmen of the RAF, and the many other heroes who sacrificed so much to defeat a cruel and relentless enemy. Larson brilliantly demonstrates that, under challenging circumstances, Churchill and his ministers skillfully managed complex operations and shook up hidebound bureaucracies. Moreover the prime minister's eloquent radio addresses galvanized his listeners and helped them endure what must have felt like an endless series of ferocious onslaughts. As Larson states in his introduction, "It is one thing to say, 'Carry on,' quite another to do it."
titles: "Only he had the power to make the nation believe that it could win."

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents:
A harrowing year of raids over England displayed stalwart courage but came at a terrible cost: nearly 45,000 were killed, over 52,000 injured, and entire city blocks destroyed.

How could the population bear the uncertainty and fear of the relentless attacks? In 𝘛𝘩𝘦 𝘚𝘱𝘭𝘦𝘯𝘥𝘪𝘥 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘝𝘪𝘭𝘦: 𝘈 𝘚𝘢𝘨𝘢 𝘰𝘧 𝘊𝘩𝘶𝘳𝘤𝘩𝘪𝘭𝘭, 𝘍𝘢𝘮𝘪𝘭𝘺, 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘋𝘦𝘧𝘪𝘢𝘯𝘤𝘦 𝘋𝘶𝘳𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘉𝘭𝘪𝘵𝘻, Larson argues that Winston Churchill modeled a dauntlessness that rallied the public. He presents an intimate look at Churchill’s inner circle during that trying year as he ramped up war production, buoyed public morale, and attempted to gain the support of the United States.

Using historical documents, including the diaries of Mary, Churchill’s youngest daughter, and John Colville, one of Churchill’s private secretaries, Larson presents both the overarching events of the year and also the very private events—the love affairs, financial woes, changing moods and idiosyncrasies—that persist even in times of war. He also relies on the journals of the Mass Observation project to convey the impact of the conflict on ordinary citizens.

Despite the existing accounts of Churchill, I felt like I was reading something entirely new because of the framing and details Larson utilizes. The text is rich and engaging with a definite sense of humor. I learned things about Rudolf Hess’s trip to Scotland and about the negotiations between Churchill and Roosevelt.

Anyone interested in World War II should read this but beyond that, anyone interested in a exemplary, well-constructed history will appreciate it as well.

𝘛𝘩𝘢𝘯𝘬 𝘺𝘰𝘶 𝘵𝘰 𝘊𝘳𝘰𝘸𝘯 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘕𝘦𝘵𝘎𝘢𝘭𝘭𝘦𝘺 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘱𝘳𝘰𝘷𝘪𝘥𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘢𝘯 𝘢𝘥𝘷𝘢𝘯𝘤𝘦 𝘳𝘦𝘢𝘥𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘤𝘰𝘱𝘺 𝘪𝘯 𝘦𝘹𝘤𝘩𝘢𝘯𝘨𝘦 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘢𝘯 𝘩𝘰𝘯𝘦𝘴𝘵 𝘳𝘦𝘷𝘪𝘦𝘸.
titles: Daily Life in England During the Blitz

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents:
The Splendid and The Vile
By: Erik Larson
5⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
Amazing, historical account of the life of Winston Churchill. The author really researched for this book. I enjoyed all the “diary” entries. The story follows Wintston Churchill, his wife Clementine and one of their children Pamela, along with Hitler and some of his high ranking staff.
🇬🇧
We are taken on a journey into their lives and the important people in their lives as Britain faces the invasion of Germany. It’s interesting to see the how the young friends of Pamela proceed with their privileged lives of parties and luxurious while the country is at war. Pamela obviously has a close relationship with her parents and admires her father immensely.
🇬🇧
If you like history, this book is well written and takes you on a journey back in time. This was a first by this author, but won’t be my last. I was able to read this book while listening to an audio version. #thesplendidandthevile, #eriklarson, #crownnewyork, #bookofthemonth, #socialdistancing, #bookstagram, #audiobook, #harkerheightslibrary, #stamperlady50, #bookworm

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents:
One may find dates and short descriptions in a text book, or you could sit through a lecture to get a bit more personality, or even watch a documentary to see some moving pictures… but you wouldn’t get the depth and insight that you do in an Erik Larson book. In The Splendid and the Vile his meticulous research and talented writing give readers a fascinating look into one year in the life of Winston Churchill. Starting in May of 1941, just before he takes office as Prime Minister, Larson details the conversations, the meetings, and the speeches, but also the eccentricities of the leader and interworking of his whole family. This year holds the surrender of the French, the beginning of The Blitz, and calls to isolationist America for help.

Even though the book is weighty at just over 600 pages, the chapters are on the smaller size and are balanced well between the British side of the war and other points of view. The descriptions of the places are excellent and drew me in immediately to each scene. Another thing is Larson’s use of diary entries. Some are derived from the public who took part in a government project to get firsthand knowledge of the war.

Personal Note: I have like now read all of Larson’s books, and while I love his writing style, I just liked the subjects of a couple of his pieces a better than others. The Devil and the While City and Thunderstruck were excellent books that contained little-known true crime mysteries. And his last three books (Dead Wake, In the Garden of Beasts, and The Splendid and the Vile) have been without much mystery and their topics have covered parts of history that one can readily find. His writing is always good and he certainly picks out smaller characters to highlight in the overall scenes of history, but I just liked the other books for their singular subjects.

The Splendid and the Vile is an excellent piece of history. Perfect for that WW2 buff who is looking to expand their knowledge of one of the great leaders of the war.
titles: The Splendid and the Vile is an excellent piece of history.

product_name: The Splendid and the Vile: A Saga of Churchill, Family, and Defiance During the Blitz
review_contents:
“If some of what follows challenges what you have come to believe about Churchill and this era, may I just say that history is a lively abode, full of surprises.”

Erik Larson wrote The Devil in the White City, and so when I saw that he had written a biography of Churchill, I leapt at the chance to read it. Thanks go to Net Galley and Crown Publishing for the review copy. This book is for sale today.

I have spent most of my life dodging stories of the second world war, largely because I had grown bored, as a young woman, hearing my father’s ramblings with friends. No young person wants to hear their parent’s stories unless they involve great fame or heroism, and perhaps not always, even then. And so, when someone older than myself would speak of “the war,” my ears closed at once. Footage of Churchill’s iconic speeches sometimes popped up on the television, but all I heard was “blah blah blah,” and I would either change the channel or leave the room. And so, it is only now—after a career of teaching American history and government to teenagers—that I find myself curious about Churchill.

The book begins when King George asks Prime Minister Neville Chamberlain—who, along with his staff, had been carrying on with ordinary length work days despite the crisis at hand, and who had been contemplating a surrender to Germany—to step down, and then invites Churchill to take his place. Churchill has no intention of surrendering a single centimeter of British soil to Hitler, and soon everyone knows this. The book ends when the United States formally enters the war. By focusing on this brief period, Larson is able to include detail, the meaty anecdotes and quotes that a full length biography would limit. That said, the hard cover version of this book is still over 600 pages in length, if one includes the thorough and excellent end notes, and if you haven’t the stamina for other books of this length, you probably won’t have the stamina for this one, either.

Since my childhood impression of Churchill was that he was dull and stodgy, I was fascinated to learn how truly unconventional he had been. He often worked 16 hour days and expected his staff to do the same, but he did so on his own terms, breaking for two baths daily (but dictating from the tub to a male secretary that sat tub side, tablet and pencil in hand), and likewise doing business from his bed, not merely over the phone, but with documents, a typist, an immense thermador to hold his two foot long cigars, and his cat, whom he called “darling.” He might be clad in a silk floral dressing gown (in America, this would be a fancy robe) and pom-pom slippers, or he might be buck naked. Today we would refer to the working baths and feet up in bed as a sort of self-care; the fact that he was able to carry it off during much more conventionally straightened times amazes me. He kept a machine gun in the trunk of his car, and he armed his family members, including the women. Invasion was a real possibility, and if it occurred, he and his family would be primary targets. He told them that if they were to be taken, possibly killed, the least they could do would be to take at least one Nazi down with them. And like so many fathers, he climbed onto the roof during Nazi bombing raids to see the action despite the risk, but made his daughter stay far away from London in the countryside lest she find herself in harm’s way.

Larson incorporates a variety of sources, but the two most frequently quoted are from Colville, who was one of his private secretaries, and Mary Churchill, his teenager. I question the amount of ink young Mary receives initially, but at the end, when I see where life took her, my objections fade. Also included are the views of top Nazi officials, primarily Joseph Goebbels, whose diary shows his dissatisfaction with Roosevelt, whose fireside chats inveighed against Fascism and in favor of the British cousins. Goebbels wishes that Hitler would take a hard line against the Americans, reflecting without an ounce of irony that “One must defend oneself sometime, after all.”

Larson’s congenial narrative draws me in almost like narrative nonfiction. Despite the death, the destruction, and the horror, it is—for me, at least—a curiously soothing read in all but one or two of the harshest spots. Perhaps it is because it was long ago and far away, and I know that—this time, at least—the Fascists will lose.

There is only one photograph in my digital review copy, and a note of a map that will be included in the finished version; I wish there were more. I came to my desktop to see images of the infamous Lord Beaverbrook, the Prof, and Pug Ismay, all of whom were Churchill’s key advisers, and I went to YouTube to listen to the Dunkirk speech and others that were so captivating and celebrated. Now that I grasped the context in which they were given, I can understand why they had an electrifying effect upon the British public and won the favor of other English-speaking nations, my own among them.

Is this the best Churchill biography? For those that want all the nitty-gritty, there are many others, and Larson refers to them in his introduction, including one that is eight volumes long. For me, though, this is enough. Those that want an approachable yet professional introduction to this subject could do a lot worse; I recommend you get it and read it, and then you can decide if you want to pursue the subject further.

Highly recommended.
